**_Verticalized offerings underpinned by leading niche proprietary software solutions, strong_**
**_technology and digital enabling capabilities, and deep understanding of business core processes_**

We believe that our solutions portfolio, by covering the full spectrum of digital enabling technologies,
is well-placed to address the digitalization trends characterizing the markets in which we operate. In the
year ended December 31, 2022, we generated 26.6% of our revenue from our activities related to
Proprietary Solutions, resulting in solid year-on-year revenue visibility as our proprietary solutions
could neither be implemented nor managed by other IT providers. Compared to the year ended
December 31, 2021, our Proprietary Solutions revenues in 2022 recorded a resilient performance. The
vast majority of revenues generated from our activities related to Proprietary Solutions is now strongly
driven by the sale of software and product-related services following the initial sale of the software
license. Our Proprietary Solutions portfolio enables us to benefit from strong competitive positions in
specific niches, particularly within the Finance, Energy & Utilities, Public Administration, Industry &
Services and Health industry verticals. Our proprietary software solutions portfolio includes four
software suite and 20 smaller products, including (i) _Grace, the leading compliance and risk_
management software program developed for financial institutions, servicing most major banks in Italy,
with a market share estimated to be double that of its closest competitor, (ii) AREAS, one of the largest
digital platforms for the digitalization and integration of clinical and administrative healthcare processes
in the hospital ERP markets and the second largest in the Italian healthcare IT market, (iii) Net@Suite,
the leading cloud-based platform for billing and CRM for all types of sales and distribution operators
in the gas and electricity markets, (iv) JEnte, one of the leading software programs for the digitalization
of processes of Italian municipalities and (v) Ellipse, a software program enabling the total digitalization
of healthcare systems by assisting clinicians in real-time diagnostics, decision and treatment activities
of their patients. Our Proprietary Solutions portfolio targets specific niches across all of our industry
verticals that are highly attractive in light of their regulated nature, the need for highly tailored solutions
and the elevated costs that customers must bear for switching providers. Furthermore, we believe that
the strong reputation of our Proprietary Solutions also allows us to up-sell and cross-sell our System
Integration and Digitech services, although we do not primarily carry out these activities in relation to
proprietary technology. In addition, our Proprietary Solutions also feature digital products including (i)


-----

_Knowage, an open source suite for modern business analytics initiatives from data visualization to deep_
analysis, (ii) _Digital Enabler, a digital platform providing a single point of data knowledge used to_
develop new value added services as well as digitally enabling older technologies and applications and
(iii) Cloudesire, our brokering and monetization platform that enables the immediate distribution of
cloud and digital services, aimed at covering a full end-to-end sell and operate capability model.
Following the completion of the Be Acquisition, our Proprietary Solutions offering has been enriched
by the Be Group’s proprietary solutions for the insurance market (including, among others, its Universo
solution for the life insurance market).

As a result of a strategic review of our business operations and positioning, we now supplement our
strong Proprietary Solutions software offering with our Digitech activities, which are aimed at providing
a cutting-edge portfolio of services for the professional customization of third-party product solutions
and, represented 36.0% of our revenue for the year ended December 31, 2022. As part of Digitech, we
offer new and advanced high-growth digital enabling capabilities designed for efficiently interacting
with the relevant third-party software, including advanced analytics, cloud-based services,
cybersecurity, customer experience, IoT, robotic process automation, AR / MR / VR and digital twin
and blockchain platforms. In addition, revenues for both our Proprietary Solutions and Digitech
portfolios are supported by our digital enabling capabilities. Moreover, through our digital services
offering, we have worked on projects including “city-as-a platform” solutions in Italy, with the aim of
increasing the degree of digitalization of the services being offered by private companies and public
entities on integrated technological platforms. We believe that our digital enabling capabilities for both
Proprietary Solutions and Digitech projects have been strengthened as a result of the integration of Be
Group’s digital division into our business, as the Be Group features an engagement hub dedicated to
the development of cutting-edge web, mobile and social media applications for customers, with a focus
on the creation and distribution of digital content and vertical digital solutions.

**_Strong focus on R&D and a highly qualified, digitally-skilled workforce_**

Innovation has always been a key element for our competitiveness and long-term sustainability. We
continuously invest in R&D and innovation to support the ongoing improvement of our organization in
increasing our competitive capacity and fulfilling the needs of a fluid, rapidly changing market. Our
investment in R&D to develop and maintain our research and project management activities has
amounted to approximately €25 million, in the year ended December 31, 2022 and, as of the date of
this Offering Memorandum, we are involved in more than 100 research projects, and our R&D Lab
department relies on a team of over 500 professionals, which includes researchers and data scientists
(both directly part of our R&D Lab department) and employees in our Development Labs, Competence
_Centers and Products Labs, who cooperate closely with our R&D Labs. We also partner with more than_
150 universities globally and have strategic alliances with several research centers globally.

We believe we are among the most active ICT research companies in Europe, attracting funds from
national and EU research programs, being ranked among the top 10 European private for profit
companies (and the first in Italy) in terms of EU funding under the European Union’s Horizon 2020
Programme for Research and Innovation. While, as of the date of this Offering Memorandum, no
official documentation has been made available yet by the European Commission, we have been
awarded research funding under the new Horizon Europe 2021-2027 Programme for over 30 initiatives
and are finalizing the grant signature process for further ten initiatives. This confirms our ability to
submit high-quality research projects, and to maintain a strong position within the European research
landscape. In the year ended December 31, 2022, we received €23 million in research funding from
Italian and European research programs.

We also deploy a significant amount of resources for the training of our technology engineers, core
process specialists and digital scientists who support our entire production cycle. Our internal “Enrico
Della Valle” IT & Management Academy, which is considered one of the leading Italian corporate
schools for IT, provides over 500 different course editions, resulting in approximately 32,000 training
days in the year ended December 31, 2022. Our academy issued approximately 1,500 certifications and


-----

trained approximately 6,000 of our employees in the year ended December 31, 2022. We believe that
our strong focus on R&D as well as the resources deployed to train our technology engineers, core
process specialists and digital scientists, coupled with our strategic acquisitions, will allow us to
continue to attract and retain skilled employees, despite the constantly increasing talent shortage in the
IT industry, which represents the key challenge in the IT sector.

**_Large and diversified customer base with highly recurring revenues and high levels of customer_**
**_satisfaction_**

We are present in all regions and most metropolitan cities in Italy (including Milan, Rome and Turin)
and operate across several sectors of the economy, including public administration, financial services,
utilities, telecommunications, transportation, infrastructure and healthcare. We have a customer base of
more than 2,750 customers, including large private and blue chip companies and public sector bodies,
among which are six of the largest Italian banks (including Intesa Sanpaolo, UniCredit and Banco
BPM), major telecommunications and media companies (including Vodafone, TIM and BT), utilities
companies (including Enel and Eni), manufacturing companies (including Stellantis), healthcare
organizations (including the Veneto region healthcare system and other large hospitals in Italy), local
public administrations (including the municipalities of Rome and Milan, as well as the IT services arm
of the Lombardy region, and the Emilia Romagna and Campania regions) and transportation and
infrastructure companies (including Ferrovie dello Stato Italiane). Following the completion of the Be
Acquisition, we believe we have further increased potential cross-selling opportunities, by leveraging
both our and Be Group’s brand recognition and strong reputation across our wide platform of customers,
while coupling our broad offer of IT services, software and digital platforms and solutions with top tier
consulting and digital services. For example, we have been deploying an end-to-end platform of
solutions aiming to address all of our customers’ IT needs, by covering the design of their IT
architecture as well as the implementation and integration of proprietary solutions and/or third-party
solutions into their systems. In addition, we benefit from a high level of exposure to medium and large
enterprise customers compared to other businesses operating within the Italian ICT sector. For the year
ended December 31, 2022, we estimate that approximately 95% of our top 50 customers are large
enterprises or public sector entities and generated 48% of our revenues, in each case after giving effect
to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies completed in 2022
(to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022.
Our business benefits from low customer concentration and significant customer diversification across
all of our industry verticals, with no customer accounting for more than 6.0% of our revenues and no
industry vertical accounting for more than 26.4% of our revenues for the year ended December 31,
2022, in each case after giving effect to the Be Acquisition as if it had been completed on January 1,
2022. For the year ended December 31, 2022, our top three customers generated approximately 16% of
our revenues, our top five customers generated approximately 22% of our revenues, and our top ten
customers generated approximately 30% of our revenues, in each case after giving effect to the Be
Acquisition as if it had been completed on January 1, 2022.

In addition, a large share of our revenues across each of our activity lines is highly recurring. In
particular, the revenues we generate from our activities related to Proprietary Solutions, accounted for
26.6% of total revenues in the year ended December 31, 2022, are highly recurring and demonstrate our


-----

long-lasting relationships with our Proprietary Solutions customers primarily as a result of the local,
highly specialized and customized nature of our Proprietary Solutions as well as their integration into
our end-customers’ IT systems, which also limits competition for our products and services in respect
of those customers. In addition, we consider the revenues we generate from our activities related to
System Integration and relating to the day-to-day management and operation services of our customers’
end-to-end infrastructure to also be recurring, as they are secured by long-term contracts. While
contractual frameworks for managed services provided as part of System Integration are usually three
to five years in length, we generally have long-term relationships with our System Integration customers
and record high levels of contract renewals. In addition, these customers display high retention rates
also due to the difficulty of switching to a different provider. Lastly, a significant portion of revenues
we generate from our activities related to Digitech is backed by high levels of contract renewals and
therefore we consider them to be recurring, also in light of our successful track record of service delivery
and our knowledge of complex IT systems.

The high share of recurring contracts with our existing customers across all of our industry verticals has
allowed us to maintain a stable revenue performance. Moreover, our ability to sell additional valueadded services to existing customers allowed us to increase spending of our existing customers over
time, thus increasing our revenue generation. After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the
acquisition by the Group of Atlantic Technologies as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022, between
January 1, 2020 and December 31, 2022, revenues generated from our top five and top ten customers
increased at CAGRs of approximately 18.4*% and 11.7*%, respectively.

**_Strong financial profile with consistent, resilient growth and cash flow generation, with further_**
**_potential to improve margin performance through cost saving initiatives_**

Over the past 20 years, our revenue expansion has been driven by mid- to high single digit organic
growth supported by continuous investments in R&D and training as well as growth from selective
value accretive acquisitions of attractive IT services assets, including, among others, our acquisitions
of Atos Origin Italia in 2008, T-Systems Italia, in 2013, Infogroup in 2017 and the Movilitas group,
Design Automation Associates, C Consulting in 2021, and PluSure S.p.A. and Atlantic Technologies
in 2022. Additionally, our revenues have remained resilient through volatile macroeconomic cycles
during the past 20 years, including through the COVID-19 pandemic, with our revenues’ organic growth
outperforming Italian GDP growth on a year-over-year basis since 2003. For the year ended December
31, 2022, we generated revenues of €1,422.6 million and Adjusted EBITDA of €207.8 million. In
addition, for the year ended ended December 31, 2022, we recorded a 10.0%* organic growth of our
revenues and, for the same period, a 19.2%* organic growth of our Adjusted EBITDA, in each case
excluding the results of our Finance industry vertical from 2021 to 2022.

Our business has historically benefitted from high cash conversion (defined as the ratio of Adjusted
EBITDA _less capital expenditure to Adjusted EBITDA, expressed as percentage), which averaged_


-----

approximately 84.5%* annually between January 1, 2020 and December 31, 2022, as a result of our
robust margin profile and limited capital expenditures from our asset-light model.

Historically, we have also been able to increase our margins as a result of continued operational
improvements and operating leverage, and we believe there is further potential to improve our margins
through operational initiatives. In particular, we have deployed several cost savings initiatives,
including (i) an initiative to streamline and optimize our workforce by facilitating turnover and filling
vacant positions with young, highly-skilled personnel coupled with an increased nearshoring presence,
(ii) the renegotiation of services and utilities contracts relating to our facilities and offices to improve
the terms thereof and (iii) other cost-saving efficiencies resulting from our company-wide transition to
smart working. Several of these measures have now been implemented in our business structure
(including, among others, few initiatives related to our procurement processes).

In addition, in 2022, as part of our ambition to implement a solid cost optimization plan, we started
implementing a comprehensive range of further cost savings and efficiency initiatives aimed at
enhancing our operations and improving our ability to respond to changes in the demand for our
products and solutions, by further increasing the flexibility of our cost structure. In the aggregate, we
expect these cost savings and efficiency initiatives to generate €16.2 million of annual run rate cost
savings by the end of 2023 (€9.8 million of which have been already achieved for the year ended
December 31, 2022), with further room for potential upside. Once achieved, we expect that these cost
savings will structurally reduce the Group’s cost base going forward. Our key cost savings and
efficiency initiatives include: (A) procurement initiatives, consisting of: (i) the streamlining of our
contractual relationships with external IT consultants through the introduction of competitive tender
procedures and a structured supplier qualification process, and (ii) the reduction of costs related to the
procurement of software products, primarily by consolidating our current software providers base into
a limited number of distributors and resellers, and consolidating our IT spend with certain selected
original equipment manufacturers (“OEMs”); (B) optimization initiatives targeting the reduction of
utilities, maintenance and rent costs related to our real estate portfolio, including the reduction of our
square footage at multiple locations and office closures in up to three out of 13 non-strategic locations
in Italy as well as the opening of a new flagship office in Milan (Italy); and (C) a broad range of other
cost saving initiatives including the outsourcing of payroll activities, the implementation of headcount
optimization and reduction projects including nearshoring in Serbia and adjacent countries,
rationalization projects aimed at consolidating our legal structure, and vendor rebate management
activities.

**_Attractive consolidation platform with track record of creating value through integration of bolt-on_**
**_acquisitions_**

We believe we are a natural consolidator in the fragmented Italian ICT Services and Software &
Solutions markets and have a strong track-record of successfully integrating acquired entities, allowing
us to expand our product offering and geographic reach, generate significant cross-selling opportunities
into our existing customer base and realize synergies, while fostering future growth. Between January
2020 and December 31, 2022, we completed 9 acquisitions (including the Be Acquisition). Our M&A
strategy also relies on our ability to leverage an enhanced level of competences and stronger R&D
capabilities following the integration of acquired businesses, with the aim of reinforcing our digital
capabilities.

We constantly evaluate opportunities for prudent, highly targeted and strategic bolt-on acquisitions,
with fair acquisition prices typically funded through organic cash flow generation. Over the past five
years, we completed more than 20 bolt-on acquisitions. Past bolt-on acquisitions include (i) Cybertech
Group in 2019, which allowed us to expand our cybersecurity offering and consolidate our leadership
position in the rapidly expanding cybersecurity segment, (ii) Deus Technology in 2019, which allowed
us to expand our finance expertise with wealth management fintech solutions, (iii) Digitelematica in
2019, which allowed us to increase our e-commerce offerings to retail customers, (iv) FDL Servizi in
2020, which allowed us to expand our software solutions for smart-grid management services, (v) C


-----

Consulting in 2021, which allowed us to strengthen our portfolio of proprietary solutions for the
reinsurance market, (vi) Movilitas group in 2021, which consolidated our position in the United States
by expanding our offering of smart solutions for the manufacturing industry, (v) PluSure S.p.A. in 2022,
which allowed us to expand our product design solutions portfolio for our industry 4.0 customers, and
strengthened the positioning of our eXcellence global division on the European markets, and (vi)
Atlantic Technologies S.p.A. in 2022, which allowed us to expand our presence in the cloud technology
area of CRM, ERP and analytics. In particular, these acquisitions enabled us to significantly strengthen
our digital product and service offering in the United States, which resulted in a €56.3 million increase
in revenues generated in the United States, from €15.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2020,
to €71.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022.

In addition, following completion of the Be Acquisition, we wholly own the Be Group, one of the
leading Italian players in the IT consulting sector and provider of business consulting, information
technology and digital business services to major financial and insurance institutions in Europe,
including Italy. As a result of the Be Acquisition, we expanded our international operations into three
new countries (Albania, Poland and Romania), while also strengthening our presence in the DACH
region (i.e., Germany, Austria and Switzerland). The successful completion of the Be Acquisition
further consolidated our leadership position in the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions
markets, in particular by enabling us to further broaden our best-in-class portfolio of consulting and
digital transformation services to customers in the markets served by our Finance industry vertical.

Through our M&A-focused team, we have developed a disciplined and clear approach to M&A activity,
targeting best-in-class specialized IT services providers with a focus on increasing our higher margin
Proprietary Solutions and Digitech portfolios, complementing our service offering and digital
capabilities by strengthening our industry-vertical specific product portfolio and thus consolidating our
leading positions across our industry verticals in order to strategically support our organic growth.

**_Strong leadership team with proven track record of delivery supported by committed Sponsors_**

Our business is supported by the experience of our senior management team, which benefits from the
experience and knowledge of our Sponsors. Following the Engineering Acquisition, highly experienced
and reputable professionals who are widely recognized for their international track record of operational
excellence and capacity to deliver have joined our senior management team. In 2021, we welcomed our
Chairman, Gaetano Miccichè, who contributes his wide knowledge of the Italian financial landscape,
our Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Maximo Ibarra, who brings a wealth of significant experience in
running high profile businesses, and our Chief Financial Officer, Mr. Massimo Cunico, who has a strong
background in the manufacturing business in Italy and internationally. Under their leadership, we have
continued to consolidate our position as one of the leading independent Italian specialist provider of IT
services, software and digital platforms through both organic growth and successful add-on acquisitions
(including the recent acquisition of the Movilitas group in 2021 and the acquisition of Atlantic
Technologies S.p.A. in 2022). Our key management team also includes our industry vertical leaders
and other corporate executives such as our Executive Vice President Digitech Fabio Momola, our Vice
President for the “Enterprise” business unit Guido Porro, our Chief HR Officer Alessia D’Addario, our
Chief Procurement and Strategic Officer Fabio Francalancia, our General Counsel Sabrina delle Curti,
and our Head of M&A Francesco G. Schininà. Our senior management team is supported by a highly
capable, committed and specialized second level management, with a proven track records of
developing and marketing innovative products and solutions, and by our project management office,
which stages 566 certified project management professionals, who ensure solid and innovative
management of our customers’ and our own projects, while enabling us to provide skilled project
management and project management office specialists across all of the markets that we service. We
also benefit from an average of 12,474 highly productive, well-trained employees as at December 31,
2022 (including the Be Group). Our constant priority is to maintain our competitiveness by
strengthening our skillset and the quality of our talent pool. To this end, in 2022 we accelerated the
intake of talent into the Group. Following completion of the Be Acquisition, the Be Group’s day-to-day
operations continue to be managed by Mr. Stefano Achermann (Be’s founder and current Chief


-----

Executive Officer), in order to ensure continuity. Since November 2022, Mr. Achermann also leads our
Finance industry vertical, and is supported by a team that was further strengthened through the addition
of certain managers of the Be Group. We believe that our highly experienced management team will
continue to focus on delivering growth and development of our operations, while ensuring the efficient
integration of the Be Group into our business.

**Our Strategies**

**_Continue to grow and build on our leading market position_**

We are a leading ICT services and Software and Solutions provider in Italy, with a market share of
approximately 13% in Implementation and 8% in Application Managed Services in terms of revenue in
2022, according to Gartner. Our revenues grew at a CAGR of 8.0%* (and at a CAGR of 9.5%, excluding
the results of our Finance industry vertical) between 2020 and December 31, 2022, despite the COVID19 outbreak, thereby contributing towards consolidating our market share in Italy. Excluding the results
of our Finance industry vertical, our organic revenue growth would have would have been 10.0%* in
2022. We believe that we are uniquely positioned to continue to grow our market share by capturing
the future growth of the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets, benefitting from
increasing penetration, digitalization across all private and public sectors, and increasing spending on
new digital enabling technologies. We believe the successful completion of the Be Acquisition has
enabled us to consolidate our leadership market position in the Finance industry vertical and to grow
our market share in the Italian market and abroad. In particular, following the successful completion of
the Be Acquisition, we are operating from offices in various new countries, including in Central and
Eastern Europe, such as Albania, Poland and Romania, while also strengthening our presence in the
DACH region (i.e., Germany, Austria and Switzerland). We intend to continue to leverage our strong
technological capabilities and broad range of digital solutions which we have successfully implemented
across our activity types, industry verticals and customers to further capture opportunities to cross-sell
and up-sell our products and services. In particular, we believe that the continuing demand for our
digital enabling technologies will present us with an opportunity to further grow our market share in
Italy. Additionally, we plan to continue to center our business around the needs of our loyal customer
base, which we believe will allow us to maintain our track record of growing our digital offerings among
our top customers.

**_Strengthen our advanced technological platform, unrivalled digital capabilities and industry_**
**_partnerships complemented by the Be Group’s proprietary platforms_**

We have a strong track record of product innovation and strive to continuously develop new and tailored
digital offerings to meet our customers’ latest digital needs. Our R&D Lab, which is the core driver of
our products and services innovation process works closely with other units of the company, including
our _Innovators Network, consisting of several innovation experts who analyze market trends and_
weaknesses and translate them into ideas for innovative solutions and products, our Development Labs,
comprising a dedicated group of professionals who develop state-of-the art marketable digital
technologies, and our Products Labs, comprising a dedicated group of professionals who are devoted
to designing, developing and maintaining our proprietary solutions. Leveraging our R&D capabilities,
we intend to further strengthen our technological platform by continuing to invest in key areas, spanning
across all of our industry verticals: cybersecurity, digital industry, smart transportation, smart city, smart
government, smart energy, digital media, cloud, big data, blockchain and AI. For example, in September
2022 we started a strategic collaboration with Leonardo S.p.A., a global leader in the aerospace, defence
& security sector, to identify projects and business opportunities to be developed jointly in the field of
Digital Transformation and Cybersecurity with a particular focus on the defense, healthcare, finance,
public administration and infrastructure sectors, including through joint R&D initiatives. In addition,
following the successful completion of the Be Acquisition, we have enriched our portfolio of proprietary
solutions, strengthening in particular our positioning as a key provider of services to the broader finance
industry.


-----

We also intend to further capitalize on our strong, long-standing relationships with key strategic
partners, who comprise next-generation technology vendors and service providers and include
worldwide leaders in public cloud and SaaS services, such as Amazon Web Services, Google and
Microsoft, ERP and CRM solutions, such as SAP, Oracle, Salesforce and Microsoft, as well as a large
pool of digital technologies providers, such as Adobe, Cisco, RedHat and VMware. We believe that our
focus on strong relationships with key industry partners will continue to allow us to provide our
customers with access to cutting-edge digital platforms and solutions. To that end, in April 2023, we
entered into a binding commitment for a partnership in respect of the digital platform of Illimity Bank
S.p.A. (“Illimity”), an established banking digital platform, including exclusive distribution rights
relating to such platform for our Finance industry vertical until 2032. This partnership is currently
expected to generate contractual revenues of €15 million per year until 2032 for the professional
services that we are expected to provide in connection with the distribution of Illimity’s platform to
third parties, while also unlocking potential upsides driven by our exclusive distribution rights, all of
which remains subject to the finalization of the long-form partnership terms, which is expected by the
end of June 2023. The total consideration for the partnership is €55.5 million (which may be increased
by €4.5 million between 2024 and 2032), which will be paid in the period from 2023 to 2026, with
approximately €10.0 million paid in 2023 and funded by cash on hand.

**_Increase our offering of Proprietary Solutions and Digitech_**

We believe that our large portfolio of leading, niche vertical proprietary solutions and services supports
our strong reputation as a leading ICT services and Software and Solutions provider in Italy and acts as
a catalyst for our broad service offerings across our industry verticals. Our portfolio of Proprietary
Solutions, which primarily targets customers in our Finance, Energy & Utilities, Public Administration,
Industry & Services and Health industry verticals, has also historically contributed to our strong margins
and highly sticky, recurring revenue from long-term, strategic customer relationships.

In addition to our Proprietary Solutions portfolio, we believe that our reputation and market positioning
are complemented by our portfolio of highly customized Digitech solutions, which we believe allows
us to cover the full spectrum of digital enabling technologies and continue to deliver cutting-edge highsolutions to our customers, capable of being integrated with both third-party and client-owned
applications.

We also intend to continue leveraging our in-house R&D capabilities and developing digital enabling
proprietary solutions to the activities we conduct in relation to Proprietary Solutions. Among others,
our existing portfolio includes Eng-DE4Bios, a system empowered by digital enabling technologies to
integrate and harmonize data available to local government and healthcare systems in Veneto, allowing
for the identification of incidences of COVID-19 infections across a defined territory. We are also
developing selected proof-of-concept (“POC”) projects to be deployed in the metaverse space, focusing
on the following areas: government, healthcare, retail, tourism and education. In addition, at the end of
2022, we signed a strategic partnership agreement with Novartis Italia, leader in the medical-scientific
research, for the development of initiatives and solutions aimed at responding to the challenges of
“Mission 6” of the PNRR by accelerating the digital transition of the Italian healthcare system through
the introduction of cutting-edge technologies in care services, patient care and healthcare facility
management. Moreover, in early 2023, we won, as part of temporary business grouping, a 10-year
concession by AGENAS for the design, implementation, and management of the National Telemedicine
Platform (“PNT”) as the lead contractor. The platform will be entirely cloud-based and will ensure
interoperability and integration. In particular, the PNT aims to connect the central administration with
local administrations, favoring the centralized governance and monitoring of telemedicine processes
implemented at the regional level, in line with “Mission 6” of the PNRR.


-----

**_Increase profitability and cash generation, including through the implementation of cost savings and_**
**_efficiency initiatives_**

We intend to continue leveraging our diversified operating platform and realizing economies of scale
to improve our margins. We intend to increase the share of proprietary software and related services,
which typically generate comparably higher margins due to the significant customization of our
products and services and often result in long-term customer relationships and recurring business.

Our business has historically benefitted from high cash conversion, which averaged approximately
84.4%* annually between January 1, 2020 and December 31, 2022, as a result of our robust margin
profile from underlying operating leverage and limited capital expenditures from our asset-light model,
as well as stable revenue and consistent Adjusted EBITDA (which grew at a CAGR of 8.0%* and
8.3%* between the year ended December 31, 2020 and the year ended December 31, 2022, and at a
CAGR of 9.5%* and 15.1%* over the same period, in each case excluding the results of our Finance
industry vertical). Our organic revenue growth was 6.7%* in the year ended December 31, 2021 and
4.0%* in the year ended December 31, 2022 (from €1,298.0* million in 2021 to €1,349.5 million in
2022). Excluding our Finance industry vertical from 2021 to 2022, our organic revenue growth would
have been 10.0%* (from €1,018.9* million in 2021 to €1,120.3 million in 2022). While our organic
Adjusted EBITDA growth was a negative 0.4% in 2022 (from €198.3* million in 2021 to €197.5 million
in 2022), excluding our Finance industry vertical from 2021 to 2022, our organic Adjusted EBITDA
growth would have been 19.2%* (from €125.1* million in 2021 to €149.2 million in 2022). To increase
our cash generation, we intend to continue implementing a disciplined approach to working capital
management and capital expenditure, which averaged approximately 2%* of revenues annually
between 2020 and 2022.

To further increase our profitability and leverage the potential to further improve our margins, we also
plan to continue focusing on implementing cost-savings measures and improve operational efficiency
across the Group. To this end, in 2022 we started implementing a comprehensive range of cost savings
and efficiency initiatives aimed at enhancing our operations and improving our ability to respond to
changes in the demand for our products and solutions, by further increasing the flexibility of our cost
structure. In the aggregate, we expect our cost savings and efficiency initiatives to generate €16.2
million of run rate cost savings by the end of 2023 (€9.8 million of which have been already achieved
for the year ended December 31, 2022). Our key cost savings and efficiency initiatives include: (A)
procurement initiatives, consisting of: (i) the streamlining of our contractual relationships with external
IT consultants through the introduction of competitive tender procedures and a structured supplier
qualification process, and (ii) the reduction of costs related to the procurement of software products,
primarily by consolidating our current software providers base into a limited number of distributors and
resellers, and consolidating our IT spend with certain selected OEMs; (B) optimization initiatives
targeting the reduction of utilities, maintenance and rent costs related to our real estate portfolio,
including the reduction of our square footage at multiple locations and office closures in up to three out
of 13 non-strategic locations in Italy as well as the opening of a new flagship office in Milan (Italy);
and (C) a broad range of other cost saving initiatives including the outsourcing of payroll activities, the
implementation of headcount optimization and reduction projects including nearshoring in Serbia and
adjacent countries, rationalization projects aimed at consolidating our legal structure, and vendor rebate
management activities.

In addition, we believe that our combination with the Be Group will deliver significant value generation,
creating an established player with strong end-to-end capabilities in the financial services sector. By the
end of 2024, we expect to generate approximately €9.5 million of further cost savings in connection
with the integration of the Be Group into our business, which we expect will structurally reduce our
cost base going forward. In connection with the achievement of these synergies, on the basis of
management estimates, we expect that we will incur one-off costs of approximately €5.0 million in
2023 and €10.0 million in 2024. We expect to realize these cost savings through initiatives related to
(i) the optimization of our subcontractor and procurement relationships, the optimization of external
workforce utilization rates and the deployment of near-shoring initiatives, (ii) the optimization and


-----

consolidation of the Group’s and Be’s combined real estate footprint and costs, (iii) the consolidation
of the Group’s and Be’s staff and administrative functions, and (iv) the reduction of compliance
expenses following the Delisting of the Be Group upon completion of the Be Acquisition.

**_Continue to pursue targeted and opportunistic acquisitions to expand capabilities and grow the_**
**_business_**

The Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets remain highly fragmented, and we intend
to further strengthen our leading position and broaden our product portfolio by continuing to consolidate
smaller players. We have developed a disciplined and systematic approach to M&A activity, targeting
best-in-class specialized IT services providers with a focus on increasing our Proprietary Solutions
portfolio, consolidating our leading positions across our industry verticals and strategically
complementing our organic growth. We execute our M&A strategy through our dedicated and
experienced in-house M&A team, who have completed 9 M&A deals between January 1, 2020 and
December 31, 2022, including the Be Acquisition. We believe that this continued focus on acquiring
and integrating best-in-class providers of IT services will allow us to further cross-sell acquired
solutions into our existing customer base and strengthen our R&D capabilities.

We will continue to evaluate opportunities for highly targeted, strategic bolt-on acquisitions, in Italy
and abroad, with a view to expanding our existing product offerings, strengthening our industry-vertical
specific product offerings and increasing our share of revenues from IP and digital capabilities. Key
recent, targeted acquisitions that have allowed us to grow our portfolio and address customers’ needs
include FDL Servizi in 2020, which allowed us to expand our software solutions for smart-grid
management services, C Consulting in 2021, which allowed us to strengthen our portfolio of proprietary
solutions for the reinsurance market, Movilitas group in 2021, which consolidated our position in the
United States by expanding our offering of smart solutions for the manufacturing industry, PluSure
S.p.A. in 2022, which allowed us to expand our product design solutions portfolio for our industry 4.0
customers, and Atlantic Technologies S.p.A. in 2022, which allowed us to expand our presence in the
cloud technology area of CRM, ERP and analytics and increase our exposure to high digital growth
platforms, while strengthening our consulting capabilities. Specifically as a result of recent bolt-on
acquisitions in the United States, we significantly strengthened our local footprint and solutions
portfolio breadth, which resulted in a €56.3* million increase in revenues generated in the United States,
from €15.2* million for the year ended December 31, 2020, to €71.5 million for the year ended
December 31, 2022.

In addition, following completion of the Be Acquisition, we wholly own the Be Group, one of the
leading Italian players in the IT consulting sector and provider of business consulting, information
technology and digital business services to major financial and insurance institutions in Europe,
including Italy. We believe that the successful completion of the Be Acquisition has further consolidated
our leadership position in the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets, in particular by
enabling us to further broaden our best-in-class portfolio of consulting and digital transformation
services to customers in the markets served by our Finance industry vertical. We expect that the ongoing
combination of our business with the Be Group will provide potential upside opportunities for revenue
and profitability growth, including by unlocking revenue synergies and by enabling us to serve as a
one-stop-shop for top-tier ITC and consulting services. In particular, we expect opportunities for
revenue synergies to arise from the cross-selling of both our and Be Group’s products, the integration
of our and Be Group’s end-to-end systems and the increase of our share of captured customer spending,
through a joint new approaching strategy aimed at tier 2 banks and insurance companies.

We continue to see interesting acquisition opportunities across verticals and consider as highly
complementary to our business strategy targets that can contribute to the even development of our
verticals, in particular industrials, finance, utilities and healthcare, as well as add to our delivery
capabilities outside of Italy.

**The Transactions**

**_The Be Acquisition Agreement and the First Be Acquisition Closing Date_**

On June 19, 2022, the Company entered into the Be Acquisition Agreement with the Sellers relating to
the indirect acquisition of 58,287,622 ordinary shares of Be, representing approximately 43.209% (or
45.630% fully diluted) of its share capital (the “Initial Be Shares”), at a unit price of €3.45 per share
(the “Purchase Price”). In addition, on June 30, 2022, the Company formally accepted the unilateral
conditional undertakings submitted on May 3, 2022 by certain shareholders of Be, other than the Sellers
(the “Additional Sellers”), to sell additional ordinary shares of Be, representing approximately 7.998%
(or 8.446% fully diluted) of its share capital (the “Additional Be Shares”), to the Company, for a price
equal to the Purchase Price, on the First Be Acquisition Closing Date. Although the Be Acquisition
Agreement includes certain customary representations, warranties and indemnities given by the Sellers
as to, _inter alia, capacity, title and disclosure, as well as certain other business representations,_
warranties and indemnities by one key Seller, the Issuer may not be able to enforce claims against the
Sellers relating to breaches of these representations, warranties and indemnities. In addition, the Sellers’
liability for any breach of the abovementioned warranties is subject to certain thresholds and limitations.
See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Be Acquisition—We may not be able to enforce claims relating
_to a breach of the representations and warranties that the Sellers have provided to the Issuer under the_
_Be Acquisition Agreement.”_

On September 26, 2022 (the “First Be Acquisition Closing Date”), Overlord Bidco successfully
completed the Initial Acquisition for an aggregate purchase price of €238 million, which was funded
with, inter alia, a portion of the proceeds from the Bridge Facility, as further described under “—The
_Financing of the Be Acquisition” below. Following completion of the Initial Acquisition, Overlord_
Bidco held approximately 51.2% of Be’s share capital.

**_The Sellers’ Reinvestment_**

On June 19, 2022, the Company, the Issuer, TopCo, Centurion HoldCo and certain other direct and
indirect holding companies controlled by our Sponsors, entered into a reinvestment and shareholders
agreement with, among others, the Sellers (as subsequently amended from time to time, the “Be
Reinvestment and Shareholders Agreement”), pursuant to which the Sellers and certain key managers
of Be and other investors agreed to invest, through Roll-Over Holdco, an aggregate maximum amount
of up to €67.1 million (the “Sellers’ Reinvestment Amount”) in the share capital of TopCo, by way of
a severable reserved capital increase to be subscribed in one or more tranches by Roll-Over Holdco,
which was approved on August 2, 2022 by the extraordinary shareholders meeting of TopCo (the
“Sellers Reinvestment”) and subscribed in three separate tranches.

On or about the First Be Acquisition Closing Date, €65.1 million of proceeds from the Sellers’
Reinvestment, funded in two separate tranches, and received by the Issuer from TopCo via an equity
contribution provided by TopCo to the Issuer, were used, together with the relevant portion of the
proceeds from drawings under the Bridge Facility and cash on balance sheet, to fund the payment the
purchase price for the Initial Be Shares and the Additional Be Shares and pay fees and expenses in
connection therewith and in relation to the entry into and drawing of the Bridge Facility, as further
described under “—The Financing of the Be Acquisition.” The third tranche of the Seller’s
Reinvestment (€2.0 million) was funded on January 13, 2023 and such proceeds (net of fees) were
contributed through a series of equity contributions from TopCo to the Issuer and from the Issuer to the
Company.

Following completion of the Sellers’ Reinvestment, as of the date of this Offering Memorandum, RollOver Holdco holds approximately 5% of TopCo’s fully diluted share capital. See “Principal
_Shareholders—Be Reinvestment and Shareholders Agreement.”_

The Be Reinvestment and Shareholders Agreement sets forth certain provisions concerning, among
other things, (i) certain corporate governance rules applicable to Be and its subsidiaries and (ii) certain


-----

rules concerning the transfer of TopCo’s shares and the potential divestment of the current direct and
indirect shareholders of the Company. See also “Summary Corporate and Financing Structure” and
“Principal Shareholders.”

In addition, pursuant to the Be Reinvestment and Shareholders Agreement, following the successful
completion of the Initial Acquisition, once commercially and operationally feasible we agreed to (i)
transfer certain ICT business activities of Be to the Group by carving out Be’s subsidiary Be Digitech
Solutions S.p.A. (excluding its advisory business unit) and integrate such activities into our Digitech
portfolio and (ii) identify a new possible “Digital Engagement Activities” commercial unit as part of
the integration of Be’s digital activities into our digital portfolio. As of the date of the Offering
Memorandum, these transactions have not yet been completed.

**_The Market Purchases, the Mandatory Offer, the Squeeze-Out and the Delisting_**

Following completion of certain additional purchases of Be’s shares pursuant to Articles 41, second
paragraph, and 42, second paragraph, of the Issuer Regulation, for an aggregate purchase price of
approximately €118 million (the “Market Purchases”) and the mandatory tender offer (the “Mandatory
Offer”) that we launched upon completion of the Initial Acquisition pursuant to Articles 102 and 106
of the Italian Financial Act on all of the then remaining outstanding shares of Be (the “MTO Be
Shares”), which we settled for an aggregate purchase price of €65 million, on December 22, 2022, i.e.,
the settlement date of the Mandatory Offer (the “MTO Settlement Date”), Overlord Bidco held a total
of 121,936,226 ordinary shares of Be which, together with Be’s 7,157,460 treasury shares, equalled to
95.7% of Be’s fully diluted share capital.

As a result of holding at least 95% of Be’s fully diluted share capital, Overlord Bidco, pursuant to
Article 111, paragraph 1, of the Italian Finance Law, purchased all of the residual 5,803,586 ordinary
shares of Be (equal to 4.3% of Be’s fully diluted share capital) from any and all minority shareholders
(the “Squeeze-Out Shares”) at a price per share equal to the Purchase Price (the “Squeeze-Out” and
together with the Initial Acquisition, the Mandatory Offer and the Market Purchases, the “Be
Acquisition”), which completed on December 28, 2022, for an aggregate purchase price of €20 million.

On December 20, 2022, the Italian stock exchange (Borsa Italiana) resolved upon the delisting of Be’s
shares from the Euronext Milan market (the “Delisting”), due to the lack of free float.

**_The Existing Revolving Credit Facility Increase_**

On or about September 19, 2022, certain lenders made available an additional facility under the Existing
Revolving Credit Facility Agreement in an aggregate principal amount of €35.0 million by way of a
fungible increase of the total commitments under the Existing Revolving Credit Facility to €195.0
million (the “Existing Revolving Credit Facility Increase”).

**_The Financing of the Be Acquisition_**

In connection with the completion of the Initial Acquisition, on September 19, 2022, the Issuer and
Overlord Bidco, as borrowers, and the Issuer, the Company and Overlord Bidco, as guarantors, entered
into the Senior Secured Bridge Facilities Agreement, which provided for, inter alia, the Bridge Facility.
The Bridge Facility was granted by the Initial Purchasers or their respective affiliates. See “Plan of
_Distribution.”_

We funded the payment of the purchase price for the Initial Be Shares and the Additional Be Shares,
the Market Purchases, the MTO Be Shares and the Squeeze-Out Shares, and the payment of fees and
expenses in connection with the Be Acquisition and the financing thereof, with proceeds from drawings
under the Bridge Facility, together with a portion of the proceeds from the Sellers’ Reinvestment and
cash on balance sheet.


-----

On or around each relevant drawing date, the Issuer on-lent the net proceeds from the drawings under
the Bridge Facility (after payment of a portion of transaction fees and expenses payable by the Issuer)
to the Company, as borrower, under an intercompany funding loan made available on or about the First
Be Acquisition Closing Date by the Issuer, as lender, providing for an aggregate principal amount of
up to €385 million (the “Overlord Funding Loan I”). In turn, on or about the same date, the Company
made corresponding drawings under the Overlord Funding Loan I and on-lent such proceeds (after
payment of a portion of transaction fees and expenses payable by the Company) to Overlord Bidco by
means of a back-to-back intercompany funding loan made available on or about the First Be Acquisition
Closing Date by the Company, as lender, to Overlord Bidco, as borrower, providing for an aggregate
principal amount of up to €385 million (the “Overlord Funding Loan II” and together with the Overlord
Funding Loan I, the “Overlord Funding Loans”). In addition to the Overlord Funding Loans, the
Company made a €61 million contribution for future share capital increase (contribuzione in conto
_futuro aumento capitale) into Overlord Bidco’s equity, using cash on balance sheet. Substantially_
concurrently with the First Be Acquisition Closing Date, the Company received €65.1 million (net of
fees) of proceeds from the Sellers’ Reinvestment (equal to the cash advanced from the Company’s
balance sheet in connection with the First Be Acquisition Closing Date) which were funded to the
Company by means of a series of equity contributions for future share capital increase (contribuzione
_in conto futuro aumento capitale). In turn, on or about the First Be Acquisition Closing and the MTO_
Settlement Date, Overlord Bidco made corresponding drawings under the Overlord Funding Loan II
and used such proceeds, together with a portion of the cash received through the equity contributions
provided by the Company, to pay the purchase price of the Initial Be Shares, and the MTO Be Shares
tendered in connection with the Mandatory Offer and the Squeeze-Out Shares, repay drawings made
under the Existing Revolving Credit Facility and refund cash on balance sheet used indirectly to finance
the Market Purchases, and to pay the remaining portion of transaction fees and expenses payable by
Overlord Bidco. See “Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Overlord Funding Loans.” As
of the date of this Offering Memorandum, €385 million are outstanding under each of the Overlord
Funding Loans.

**The Engineering-Overlord Bidco Merger and the Be-Be Opco Merger**

Overlord Bidco holds 100% of Be’s fully diluted share capital and voting rights and the Delisting has
been achieved. As a result, we intend to (i) consummate a merger by incorporation of Overlord Bidco
into the Company (the “Engineering-Overlord Bidco Merger”) and (ii) consummate a separate merger
of Be with Be Opco (the “Be-Be Opco Merger”). While there is no set timeline for either of these
mergers, we expect they will be consummated only after completion of the Engineering Merger, as
described under “—The Whitewash and the Engineering Merger” below. Upon completion of the
Engineering-Overlord Bidco Merger, Overlord Bidco will no longer be a separate legal entity, and
therefore will no longer be a Guarantor. In addition, the Overlord Funding Loan II, and any security
interest granted in respect of it, will cease to exist. The pledge on the shares of Overlord Bidco held by
the Company (or MergerCo, following the Engineering Merger) will also cease to exist as a result of
such merger, and the Notes will instead be secured by a pledge to be granted within ten Business Days
of the Engineering-Overlord Bidco Merger on all the shares of Be or the entity resulting from the BeBe Opco Merger (as the case may be) held by the Company (or MergerCo, following the Engineering
Merger). See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Be Acquisition—The Engineering-Overlord Bidco
_Merger will result in the release of certain security interests and Be or the resulting entity of the Be-Be_
_Opco Merger will not grant security or a Notes Guarantee in favor of the Notes.”_

**The Whitewash and the Engineering Merger**

On February 25, 2022, the Company’s board of directors authorized the Whitewash Procedure.
Subsequently, on March 28, 2022, the Company’s extraordinary shareholders’ meeting resolved upon
the implementation of the Whitewash Procedure and therefore the Company, having set aside
distributable profits and available reserves for this purpose, provided a guarantee, _inter alia, for the_
Existing Notes and the Existing Term Loan, in each case, subject to applicable limitations deriving from
the Whitewash Procedure. In addition, on May 9, 2022, the Company granted a security interest over
its shares in EDH securing the Existing Notes, the Existing Term Loan and the Existing Revolving
Credit Facility Agreement, in each case, subject to certain limitations as described below.

As a result of the Whitewash Procedure, the guarantee and the security interests granted by the Company
in respect of the Existing Notes and the Existing Term Loan are subject to a limitation with respect to
the amount that can be guaranteed and secured (as applicable) under the security interests and guarantee
in accordance with the Existing Indenture and the Existing Term Loan Agreement, respectively. In
particular, as of the date of this Offering Memorandum, the amounts of profits and available reserves
set aside, and therefore the amount constituting the limitation on the guarantee and the associated
security interest granted by the Company in connection with the Existing Notes and the Existing Term
Loan under the Whitewash Procedure, is currently equal to approximately €114.4 million in the
aggregate. In addition, on May 9, 2022, the Company agreed to accede as an additional borrower and
additional guarantor to the Existing Revolving Credit Facility, and to be bound by the terms of the
Existing Revolving Credit Facility Agreement, subject to the conditions and limitations set forth therein
(which do not include limitations under the Whitewash Procedure. Such limitations under the
Whitewash Procedure will not apply to the Collateral and Guarantees granted by the Company in respect
of the Notes). See “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and
_Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests—Italy.”_

On the Issue Date, the Company will also guarantee the Notes. See “The Offering—Collateral.”

The merger between the Issuer and the Company in accordance with Articles 2501-bis and following
of the Italian Civil Code (the “Engineering Merger”) was resolved upon by the board of directors of the
Issuer on February 22, 2023 and the board of directors of the Company on February 23, 2023 and then
resolved upon by the respective extraordinary shareholders’ meetings on March 9, 2023, promptly
thereafter with relevant filings of the required merger documents (including the merger plan, a report
by the directors of the companies involved in the Engineering Merger (relazione dell’organo
_amministrativo) and a report by an independent expert appointed by the Court of Rome, assessing the_
sustainability of debt at the level of MergerCo) with the competent authorities being made promptly
after each relevant approval. We currently expect to complete the Engineering Merger in the first half
of 2023, with retroactive effect (from a tax and accounting standpoint) from January 1, 2023. We refer
to the surviving entity of the Engineering Merger as “MergerCo.” As a result of the Engineering Merger,
MergerCo will assume the Issuer’s obligations under the Notes, and the Guarantee of the Notes by the
Company is expected to be released. The Engineering Merger is subject to certain conditions and may
not be completed within the envisaged timeframe or at all. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the

the Engineering Merger Date, the Existing Notes and the Notes will be secured by the Post-Engineering
Merger Collateral. See also “The Offering—Security” and “Description of the Notes—Security.”

Upon consummation of the Engineering Merger and the granting of the Post-Engineering Merger
Collateral, certain of the security granted under the Initial Collateral and the Post-Issue Date Collateral
(if any) will cease to exist and the Notes will be secured by the security interests in the Post-Engineering
Merger Collateral.

**Recent Developments**

**_Dismissal of the Company’s involvement in proceedings relating to the Investigation by Italian_**
**_Authorities into Tenders Involving Azienda Trasporti Milanesi S.p.A._**

On June 23, 2020, the Company received notice that an investigation was being undertaken by
authorities in Italy involving Azienda Trasporti Milanesi S.p.A. (“ATM”), the company wholly owned
by the municipality of Milan (Comune di Milano) that manages the Milan metro system, as well as eight
other companies, including the Company. The investigation involved allegations that certain public
tenders involving ATM were impacted by improper benefits provided by employees of the companies
under investigation, including seven employees of the Company, including the head of the Company’s
transportation business sub-segment, who was appointed to that position in September 2019. In
connection with the investigation, four of the Company’s employees subject to the investigation were
initially placed under house arrests and were subsequently released following the pretrial hearings for
the gathering of evidence before the beginning of the criminal proceeding (incidente probatorio) that
was held on November 4, 2020. In relation to such events, the relevant authorities have also investigated
the Company as well as the other companies for alleged violations of LD 231/2001, the Italian law on
corporate liability for crimes, and in particular corruption. In December 2021, the prosecutors
announced the completion of the preliminary investigation. On June 23, 2022, the prosecutors issued a
request of indictment (rinvio a giudizio) against certain employees subject to the investigation and
separated the proceeding related to the Company from the proceeding relating such employees pursuant
to a separation decision (provvedimento di stralcio). On November 9, 2022, the general public
prosecutor endorsed the public prosecutor’s decree (issued on September 17, 2022) to dismiss any case


-----

against the Company, thus confirming the dismissal of the Company’s position. As a result, the
Company is no longer involved in this criminal proceeding.

See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to Our Business and Industry— _We may incur liabilities, be restricted_
_from participating in public tenders, suffer reputational damage or be prosecuted for the actions of our_
_directors, employees, agents, representatives, advisors and intermediaries who engage in illegal_
_activities, including under LD 231/2001.”_

**Recent Trading**

Based on preliminary results derived from our unaudited management accounts and other information
currently available, we estimate that for the two months ended February 28, 2023, we generated
revenues of €248.5 million, compared to €205.8* million for the same period in 2022.

We estimate that during the two months ended February 28, 2023, demand for our products and services
was strong across all of our activity types and all of our industry verticals, particularly in our Healthcare
and Finance industry verticals. In addition, our revenues for the two months ended February 28, 2023
were driven by the integration of Be into our results following completion of the Be Acquisition, as
well as the quick start-up of the National Telemedicine Platform project, after the Group winning a 10year concession for its development in early 2023. We also estimate that our revenues for the two
months ended February 28, 2023 were impacted by lower revenues in our Public Administration
industry vertical, due to a slow start of certain PNRR projects, although we expect our activity levels
driven by the PNRR to significantly increase compared to 2022.

Furthermore, we estimate that for the two months ended February 28, 2023, we generated Adjusted
EBITDA of approximately €20 million, substantially in line with the same period in 2022*.

Key drivers of our Adjusted EBITDA for the two months ended February 28, 2023 included profitable
growth across all of our industry verticals as a result of the quick start-up of the National Telemedicine
Platform project and the positive trend recorded by Atlantic Technologies, which was offset by lower
performance of our Public Administration industry vertical, due to a slow start of certain PNRR projects,
as described above, and an increase in our overall labor cost base, including as a result of the Be
Acquisition and the general surging inflationary environment. We also estimate that our Adjusted
EBITDA for the two months ended February 28, 2023 benefitted from the cost-saving initiatives we
started to implement during 2022, in addition to those that were already undergoing, such as the rebates
programs and the real estate footprint optimization.

In the two months ended February 28, 2023, our business proved resilient on the back of continued
demand from customers, with sales bookings improving by approximately 49% from approximately
€340 million for the first two months of 2022 compared to approximately €507 million in the same
period of 2023. Our sales bookings consist of (i) revenues that we expect to generate from customer
orders in the relevant reference period, in respect to which we started providing services and which,
therefore, generate backlog in such period, and (ii) the share of revenues that is contractually guaranteed
under our multi-year framework agreements with customers with respect to a reference period,
including in advance of receiving the underlying customer orders.

In addition, we estimate that the net financial indebtedness of the Company and its consolidated
subsidiaries as of February 28, 2023 was €1.202 million, an increase of €46.7 million from €1.155
million as of January 1, 2023. These net financial indebtedness amounts reflect, among other things, (i)
the net impact on our cash position as of February 28, 2023 and January 1, 2023, from the sales of trade
receivables in the ordinary course of business we made prior to February 28, 2023 and January 1, 2023,
respectively, and (ii) the amounts of cash for R&D grants collected on behalf of our partners during the
two months ended February 28, 2023 and the year ended December 31, 2022, respectively. For a
summary of the net debt position of the Issuer as adjusted to give effect to the Transactions, please see

**Our Principal Shareholders—Bain Capital and NB Renaissance**

Bain Capital is a leading global private investment firm that advises and manages capital across several
asset classes, including private equity, public equity, fixed income and credit, venture capital and real
estate investments across multiple sector industries and geographies. Since its inception in 1984, Bain
Capital has made private equity investments in more than 1,200 companies in a broad range of industries
including healthcare, consumer/retail, technology, financial and business services and technology. Bain
Capital’s global team of over 650 investment professionals and over 1,500 employees creates value for
its portfolio companies through its global platform and depth of expertise, managing approximately
$160 billion in total and leveraging the firm’s shared platform to capture opportunities in strategic areas
of focus, with a track record of consistent value creation through focus on growth and partnering with


-----

management. Bain Capital has a strong track record of investing in the business services space with
over 50 current or past investments. The firm not only has a strong track record of investments in
Technology, Media and Telecommunications companies such as Kantar, Nets, Nexi, TeamSystem,
Worldpay and Zellis, but also in transformational investments in Italy, including its investments in
Cerved, Deltatre, Fedrigoni and Italmatch Chemicals. Bain Capital has investors from across the world
that include sovereign wealth funds, public pension funds, foundations, insurance companies, family
offices, high-net-worth individuals and funds of funds. Headquartered in Boston, Bain Capital has 23
offices worldwide, including in Chicago, Dublin, Guangzhou, Hong Kong, Lisbon, London,
Luxembourg, Madrid, Melbourne, Mumbai, Munich, New York, Palo Alto, San Francisco, Seoul,
Shanghai, Singapore Sydney, and Tokyo.

NB Renaissance is an investment firm with a focus on companies with a high growth potential primarily
headquartered in Italy. Founded in 2015 by the management team as the spin-off of Intesa Sanpaolo
Private Equity sponsored by Neuberger Berman Group LLC (“Neuberger Berman”), NB Renaissance
currently manages €2.5 billion in assets and is invested in 12 companies with an aggregate turnover of
approximately €6 billion, including: Arbo, Engineering, Inetum, Neopharmed Gentili, OverIT and Sicit.
NB Renaissance is focused on value creation initiatives including the implementation of ESG best
practices and buy-and-build, and leverages a strong network in Italy catered by a dedicated team of 25
professionals based in Milan and Luxembourg, supported by Neuberger Berman’s global private
markets platform. Neuberger Berman, founded in 1939, is a private, independent, employee-owned
investment manager. As of March 31, 2023, Neuberger Berman had $436 billion in client assets,
including approximately $140 billion in alternative assets (mainly private equity). Neuberger Berman
employs over 2,700 professionals, of which approximately 750 are investment professionals averaging
18 years of industry experience, across 39 cities and 26 countries globally.

management team. In addition, following completion of the Sellers’ Reinvestment, Roll-Over Holdco
holds approximately 5% of TopCo’s fully diluted share capital. See “Summary Corporate and
_Financing Structure” and “Principal Shareholders.”_

_that if the Engineering Merger becomes effective prior to the date on which the Post-Issue Date Collateral has been_
granted, the Notes (x) will not be secured by the Post-Issue Date Collateral and (y) will instead be secured, subject to the
Agreed Security Principles and certain perfection requirements, by the Post-Engineering Merger Collateral within the
later of 30 days from (and excluding) the Issue Date and ten Business Days from (and excluding) the Engineering Merger
Date. Within ten Business Days from (and excluding) the Engineering Merger Date, the Notes will be secured, subject to
the Agreed Security Principles and certain perfection requirements, by the Post-Engineering Merger Collateral. Subject
to the Agreed Security Principles, the Initial Collateral and the Post-Issue Date Collateral also secures, and following the
Engineering Merger, the Post-Engineering Merger Collateral will secure the Issuer’s obligations under the Existing Notes,
the Existing Revolving Credit Facility, certain hedging obligations (if any) and the Existing Term Loan on a pari passu
basis. Each of the Initial Collateral, the Post-Issue Date Collateral and the Post-Engineering Merger Collateral is further
described under “Description of the Notes—Security.” Under the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and subject to
applicable laws, the holders of Notes will receive proceeds from the enforcement of the Collateral (x) only after the
lenders under the Existing Revolving Credit Facility and counterparties to certain hedging obligations (if any) have been
repaid in full and (y) on a pari passu basis with the holders of the Existing Notes and the lender under the Existing Term
Loan. Any remaining proceeds received upon any enforcement action over any Collateral will be applied pro rata to the
repayment of all obligations under the Indenture and any other senior secured indebtedness of the Issuer and the
Guarantors permitted to be incurred and secured by such Collateral pursuant to the Indenture and the Intercreditor
Agreement. The security interests in the Collateral will be limited by applicable law and subject to certain defenses that


-----

may limit their validity and enforceability and may be released under certain circumstances. For further information, see
“Description of the Notes—Security,” “Certain Insolvency Law Considerations and Limitations on the Validity and
_Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests” and “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes, the_
_Guarantees and the Security Interests.” Subject to and as set forth in “Description of the Notes—Withholding Taxes,” the_
Issuer will not be liable to pay any Additional Amounts to holders of the Notes in relation to any withholding or deduction
required pursuant to Decree No. 239, if the Notes are held by a person resident in a country that is not included in the list
issued under Article 11(4)(c) of Decree No. 239, and otherwise in the circumstances as described in “Description of the
_Notes—Withholding Taxes.”_

(11) On July 23, 2020, in connection with the Engineering Acquisition, the Issuer, as lender, and the Company, as borrower,

entered into the Existing Funding Loan. A portion of the proceeds from the Existing Funding Loan was used to refinance
certain indebtedness of the Company in connection with the Engineering Acquisition. As of December 31, 2022,
approximately €114.4 million in aggregate principal amount were outstanding under the Existing Funding Loan. See
“Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and the Security Interests—The principal amount of the
_Existing Funding Loan and the Overlord Funding Loans forming part of the Collateral may be less than anticipated as a_
_result of prepayments of certain indebtedness of the Group prior to the maturity date of the Notes” and “Description of_
_Certain Financing Arrangements—Existing Funding Loan.”_

(12) On or about the First Be Acquisition Closing Date, in order to distribute the proceeds from the Bridge Facility, from the

Issuer to Overlord Bidco to be used in connection with the Transactions, we entered into the Overlord Funding Loans,
consisting of (i) the Overlord Funding Loan I, a first intercompany loan agreement by and between the Issuer, as lender,
and the Company, as borrower, providing for an aggregate principal amount of up to €385 million, and (ii) the Overlord
Funding Loan II, a second back-to-back intercompany loan agreement entered by and between the Company, as lender,
and Overlord Bidco, as borrower, providing for an aggregate principal amount of up to €385 million. See “Description of
_Certain Financing Arrangements—Overlord Funding Loans.” On or around each relevant drawing date under the Bridge_
Facility in connection with the Be Acquisition, the Issuer on-lent the net proceeds from such drawings (after payment of
a portion of transaction fees and expenses payable by the Issuer) to the Company, as borrower, under the Overlord Funding
Loan I. In turn, on or about the same date, the Company made corresponding drawings under the Overlord Funding Loan
I and on-lent such proceeds (after payment of a portion of transaction fees and expenses payable by the Company) to
Overlord Bidco by means of the Overlord Funding Loan II. In addition to the Overlord Funding Loans, the Issuer also
funded approximately additional €61 million of cash to the Company, which in turn contributed the funds received to
Overlord Bidco’s equity, using cash on balance sheet. In turn, on or about the First Be Acquisition Closing and the MTO
Settlement Date, Overlord Bidco made corresponding drawings under the Overlord Funding Loan II and used such
proceeds, together with a portion of the cash received through the equity contributions provided by the Company, to pay
the purchase price of the Initial Be Shares, and the MTO Be Shares tendered in connection with the Mandatory Offer and
the Squeeze-Out Shares, and to pay the remaining portion of transaction fees and expenses payable by Overlord Bidco.
See “Description of Certain Financing Arrangements—Overlord Funding Loans.” See also “Summary—The
_Transactions—The Financing of the Be Acquisition.” As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, €385 million are_
outstanding under each of the Overlord Funding Loans.

(13) Overlord Bidco is a holding company incorporated under the laws of Italy as a joint stock company (società per azioni)

and designated as purchaser pursuant to the Be Acquisition Agreement. Overlord Bidco has no independent business
operations, other than those in connection with its incorporation and the Be Acquisitions, and has no material assets or
any revenue generating assets. Overlord Bidco is currently not expected to engage in any activities other than those related
to the Be Acquisition and any other transactions permitted by the Indenture. Be is a joint stock company organized and
existing under the laws of Italy. Following the successful completion of the Be Acquisition, Overlord Bidco owns 100%
of Be’s share capital. As a result, we intend to (i) consummate the Engineering-Overlord Bidco Merger and (ii) Be-Be
Opco Merger. While there is no set timeline for either of these mergers, we expect they will be consummated only after
completion of the Engineering Merger. Upon completion of the Engineering-Overlord Bidco Merger, Overlord Bidco
will no longer be a separate legal entity, and therefore will no longer be a Guarantor. In addition, the Overlord Funding
Loan II, and any security interest granted in respect of it, will cease to exist. The pledge on the shares of Overlord Bidco
held by the Company (or MergerCo, following the Engineering Merger) will also cease to exist as a result of such merger,
and the Notes will instead be secured by a pledge to be granted within ten Business Days of the Engineering-Overlord
Bidco Merger on all the shares of Be or the entity resulting from the Be-Be Opco Merger (as the case may be) held by
the Company (or MergerCo, following the Engineering Merger). See “Summary—The Transactions—The Engineering_Overlord Bidco Merger and the Be-Be Opco Merger.”_

(14) None of the subsidiaries of the Company other than Overlord Bidco is expected to guarantee the Notes. Upon completion
