**Overview**

We are a leading specialist provider of IT services, software and digital solutions in Italy, with a market
share of approximately 13% in Application & Infrastructure Implementation and 8% in Application
Managed Services, ranking first in three of the five industry verticals under Implementation services in
which we operate, in each case calculated in terms revenue (constant currency basis), in 2022, according
to Gartner® research (Gartner Inc., Market Share: IT Services Worldwide 2022, April 2023). We
provide a holistic suite of leading software and digital solutions to more than 2,750 customers, including
companies and public administration entities, and focus on supporting our customers in digital
transformation projects through a portfolio of integrated ICT solutions, products and consultancy
services. We couple new and advanced digital enabling capabilities, including artificial intelligence AI
and advanced analytics, cloud-based services, cybersecurity, customer experience, IoT, robotic process
automation, AR / MR / VR, blockchain and digital twin platforms, with a strong know-how of
traditional technological solutions and an intimate knowledge of our broad client base’s core processes.
For the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated revenues of €1,422.6 million and Adjusted
EBITDA of €207.8 million (representing an Adjusted EBITDA Margin of 14.6%). In addition,
following settlement of the Mandatory Offer on December 22, 2022 and completion of the SqueezeOut on December 28, 2022, we successfully completed the Be Acquisition, and as of the date of this
Offering Memorandum, we wholly own the Be Group. The Be Group is one of the leading Italian
players in the IT consulting sector and provider of business consulting, information technology and
digital business services to major financial and insurance institutions in Europe, including Italy. The Be
Group also showcases distinctive capabilities in specialized areas such as services for corporate
investment banking and capital markets (including process design solutions, back-office systems, and
capital markets accounting and brokerage platforms), as well as the payments sector (including card
based products, value-added services and open banking models, as well as services for payment systems
and schemes). After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other


-----

companies completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had
occurred on January 1, 2022, we estimate that the aggregated revenues of the Group for the year ended
December 31, 2022 would have been €1,636.8 million. In addition, after adjusting our Adjusted
EBITDA to include the Adjusted EBITDA of the Be Group and the Adjusted EBITDA of certain
companies acquired in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s Adjusted EBITDA for
the year ended December 31, 2022), the expected run rate impact from certain ongoing cost saving
activities that we started implementing in 2022, and the impact of certain cost savings synergies
expected to be generated from the integration of the Be Group into our business, in each case, as if such
acquisitions were completed, and such initiatives, actions and cost savings synergies were fully
implemented, as of January 1, 2022, we estimate that our Pro Forma Run Rate Adjusted EBITDA for
the year ended December 31, 2022 would have been €256.9 million.

We operate in the attractive and growing Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets which
proved resilient against the COVID-19 pandemic and, according to Anitec-Assinform, grew at a CAGR
of approximately 4.4% between 2019 and 2021. In 2021, these markets were worth approximately €21.8
billion. The Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets benefit from strong ongoing
digitalization across the Italian public and private sectors and increasing spending in transformation
projects from traditional IT to new digital enabling technologies, which further increased underpinned
by the PNRR adopted by the Italian government in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Our leading
position in the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets, which has been further
consolidated following the successful completion of the Be Acquisition, coupled with our deep local
and regional market knowledge and long-lasting relationships with our customers and partners,
uniquely positions us to capitalize on the strong growth in demand for IT transformation services in
Italy, which is expected to grow at a CAGR of 8.4% between 2021 and 2025, according to AnitecAssinform.

We offer our IT services, software and digital platforms and solutions to our customers by engaging in
four distinct activity types: Proprietary Solutions, Digitech, System Integration and Consulting:

- **Proprietary Solutions: We offer a wide range of cutting-edge customized, end-to-end IT**
services such as industry-specific, innovative vertical software and related services, primarily
to customers in our Finance, Energy & Utilities, Public Administration, Telco & Media and
Health industry verticals. Our Proprietary Solutions relate to four main software suites, and a
longer tail of approximately 20 smaller products, all developed in-house and owned by us. Our
Proprietary Solutions comprise end-to-end service partnerships with certain of our customers
through which we provide tailored digital service packages which also include System
Integration services. We estimate that, in 2021, we were one of the leading providers of
governance, risk and compliance reporting software for financial institutions, CRM solutions
and billing platforms for utilities providers and healthcare ERP solutions for hospitals in Italy
based on revenue. We generated 26.6% of our revenues in the year ended December 31, 2022
from our activities related to Proprietary Solutions. Following the Be Acquisition, we have
integrated a portion of Be Group’s products and solutions into our Proprietary Solutions
portfolio (including, among others, Be Group’s proprietary digital platforms). After giving
effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies
completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had
occurred on January 1, 2022, we estimate for the year ended December 31, 2022 we would
have generated 24% of the aggregated revenues of the Group from activities related to
Proprietary Solutions.

- **Digitech: We develop and customize high-growth, state-of-the-art digital enabling solutions**
for third-party software, and, in particular, using advanced analytics, cloud, cybersecurity,
customer experience, IoT, robotic process automation, AR / MR / VR, digital twin and
blockchain technologies in cooperation with our partners, including, among others, Microsoft,
Google, Amazon, SAS, IBM and Oracle. In addition, we are also a leading service provider and
system integrator in Italy, customizing and developing third-party digital-enabled IT solutions


-----

through strategic partnerships with major software providers such as Salesforce and SAP. We
provide our Digitech activities on the basis of software and other technological products that
are non-proprietary, with the aim of offering highly customized solutions capable of being
integrated with both third-party and client-owned applications. In addition, as part of our
Digitech portfolio we support, maintain and update third party applications and offer projectbased system integration services for customers as well as software providers. Following the
acquisition of Atlantic Technologies, an international ICT consultancy firm with three offices
worldwide and more than 200 specialized and certified professionals, in 2022, we offer its
services as part of our Digitech portfolio. We generated 36.0% of our revenues in the year ended
December 31, 2022, from our activities related to Digitech. Following the successful
completion of the Be Acquisition, we have integrated a portion of Be Group’s solutions into
our Digitech portfolio (including, among others, certain of Be Group’s ICT solutions). After
giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies
completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had
occurred on January 1, 2022, we estimate for the year ended December 31, 2022 we would
have generated 33% of the aggregated revenues of the Group from activities related to Digitech.

- **System Integration: Our System Integration services comprise integration services related to**
the implementation, managing and maintenance of traditional IT solutions, as well as day-today management and operation services of our customer’ end-to-end infrastructure, including
hosting and desktop management. In addition, our System Integration portfolio comprises other
specialized services we offer to our customers, such as complex information systems,
customized system architectures and applications integration services (for new or existing
hardware and software). Our System Integration portfolio is also supported by our strong knowhow legacy. We generated 32.4% of our revenues in the year ended December 31, 2022 from
our activities related to System Integration solutions. Following the successful completion of
the Be Acquisition, we have integrated a portion of Be Group’s solutions into our System
Integration portfolio (including, among others, the activities of Be’s subsidiary Be Digitech
Solutions S.p.A.). After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of
certain other companies completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s
results) as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022, we estimate for the year ended December
31, 2022, we would have generated 28% of the aggregated revenues of the Group from activities
related to System Integration.

- **Consulting: Our Consulting activities comprise the business consulting, information**
technology and digital business services offered by the Be Group, mainly to major financial
and insurance institutions in Europe, including Italy. We generated 5.0% of our revenues in the
year ended December 31, 2022 from our activities related to Consulting, representing the
portion of Be’s revenues relating to business consulting, information technology and digital
business services for the period from its consolidation into our results (i.e., September 26, 2022)
until December 31, 2022. After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the
Group of certain other companies completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the
Group’s results) as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022, we estimate for the year ended
December 31, 2022, we would have generated 14% of the aggregated revenues of the Group
from activities related to Consulting.

We operate in Italy as well as in 20 countries worldwide including major European countries (such as
Belgium, France, Germany, Spain, Switzerland and the United Kingdom), the United States and Latin
American countries, such as Brazil. For the year ended December 31, 2022, revenues generated from
customers outside of Italy accounted for 18.3% of our total revenues. Moreover, following the
completion of the Be Acquisition, we strengthened our international operations, as we offer Be Group’s
products and services in three additional new countries (Poland, Romania and Albania), and increased
our presence in Germany, Austria and Switzerland. After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the
acquisition by the Group of certain other companies completed in 2022 (to the extent not already
reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022, we estimate that


-----

approximately 21% of aggregated revenues of the Group would have been generated outside of Italy
for the year ended December 31, 2022. In Italy, we are present in all regions and most metropolitan
cities (including Milan, Rome and Turin) and operate across several sectors of the economy, including
public administration, financial services, utilities, telecommunications, transportation, infrastructure
and healthcare. In particular, we operate our activity types with industry-specific process knowledge
across six industry verticals, which correspond to our reporting segments under IFRS 8 (Operating
_Segments) and represent the verticals or strategic markets in which we operate, with industry-specific_
knowledge supported technologies and competences. Our six industry verticals are Finance, Health,
Industry & Services, Telco & Media, Energy & Utilities and Public Administration. In addition, for
internal reporting purposes, in 2022 we implemented a strategic initiative focusing on the consolidation
of our Energy & Utilities, Industry & Services and Telco & Media industry verticals into a new business
unit, “Enterprise,” and, in 2023, of our Health and Public Administration industry verticals into our new
“Public Sector” business unit. We believe that our new “Enterprise” business unit will increase our
ability to effectively respond to our customers’ needs, with the aim to deliver high-performing solutions
and strengthen our role in rapidly evolving markets. In particular, we believe that through “Enterprise”
we will increase the coordination between our industry verticals, while unlocking the ability to develop
high-quality digital systems for the delivery of cross-domain solutions.

specialized products and services that we integrate into our end-customers’ IT systems. Our average

concentration and significant customer diversification across all of our industry verticals, with no
customer accounting for more than 6.0% of our revenues and no industry vertical accounting for more

We believe our success and leading position in the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions
markets is largely dependent on our strong focus on R&D, and we invested approximately €25 million
in R&D in the year ended December 31, 2022. As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, we are
involved in more than 100 research projects, and our R&D Lab department relies on a team of over 500
professionals, which includes researchers and data scientists (both directly part of our R&D Lab
department) and employees in our Development Labs, Competence Centers and Products Labs, who
cooperate closely with our R&D Labs.

We believe that the Be Acquisition enabled us to create a strong industrial combination and to further
consolidate our strong position in the markets served by our Finance industry vertical as well as our
end-to-end capabilities, given Be Group’s large addressable market, underpinned by strong underlying
market trends. Following the completion of the Be Acquisition, we believe we have further increased
potential cross-selling opportunities, by leveraging both our and Be Group’s brand recognition and
strong reputation across our wide platform of customers, while coupling our broad offer of IT services,
software and digital platforms and solutions with top tier consulting services. For example, we have
been deploying an end-to-end platform of solutions aiming to address all of our customers’ IT needs,
by covering the design of their IT architecture as well as the implementation and integration of
proprietary solutions and/or third-party solutions into their systems. Moreover, following completion
of the Be Acquisition, our customer base includes Be Group’s customers, which comprise major
financial and insurance institutions, such as UniCredit, Nexi, MasterCard and Poste Italiane S.p.A.,
along with Italian industrial players, some of which are already customers of the Group. After giving
effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies completed in
2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on January 1,
2022, we estimate that the Be Group would have comprised approximately 16% of the aggregated
revenues of the Group for the year ended December 31, 2022.

**Our Strengths**

**_Leading player in the attractive Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets with strong_**
**_growth driven by digital transformation secular trend_**

The Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets grew at a CAGR of approximately 4.4%
between 2019 and 2021, and were worth approximately €21.8 billion in 2021. In addition, the Italian
ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets are forecast to grow at a CAGR of 8.4% between 2021
and 2025, mainly driven by (i) increasing penetration of the Italian ICT Services and Software &
Solutions markets, which has further accelerated as a result of the growing reliance on remote working
as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, (ii) digitalization across all private and public clients, and
increasing spending in transformation projects from traditional IT to new digital enabling technologies
and (iii) increasingly mission critical nature of IT services spending.

The Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets have historically been, and remain,
underpenetrated compared to certain equivalent markets in other European countries, according to
management estimates, which we believe provides us with opportunities for significant further growth,
including in connection with the implementation by the Italian government and regulators of policies
that favor digitalization through IT investments, such as the Industry 4.0 plan and the PNRR,
particularly with respect to its “Mission 1”, which allocates a budget of approximately €30 billion to
investments in digitalization, innovation, competitiveness, culture and tourism, and its “Mission 6”,
which allocates a budget of approximately €11 billion to investments in innovation, research and


-----

digitalization of the national healthcare system. These policies are aimed at increasing the penetration
of IT services in Italy and supporting the digital transition in the country, with expected additional
information and communication technology investments, particularly in the areas of connectivity,
digital transition and enhanced digitalization. The following chart shows a breakdown of the PNRR’s
expected investments across its six missions by the end of 2026, along with an overview of certain key
initiatives addressable by the Group included under its “Mission 1” and “Mission 6:”

______________

_addressable initiatives under “Mission 1” and “Mission 6” by the Group._

We believe that our strategic positioning and clear focus on innovation and digital transformation
represents a naturally close match to the objectives of PNRR’s “Mission 1” and “Mission 6.” Growth
in the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets is mainly driven by strong ongoing
digitalization across the Italian public and private sectors, with increased IT services spending on and
diversified growth of new digital enabling technologies, such as (i) IoT (which is expected to grow by
approximately 8.8% between 2022 and 2025), (ii) cloud (which is expected to grow by approximately
24.5% between 2022 and 2025), (iii) big data (which is expected to grow by approximately 12.7%
between 2022 and 2025), (iv) cyber security (which is expected to grow by approximately 14.0%
between 2022 and 2025), (v) AI (which is expected to grow by approximately 21.7% between 2022 and
2025 and (vi) blockchain (which is expected to grow by approximately 26.5% between 2022 and 2025),
according to Anitec-Assinform. See “Industry and Market Overview.”

Additionally, growth in IT services spend is also driven by the increasingly mission-critical nature of
IT services in business operations, which we expect to result in IT services spend in Italy becoming
more resilient in the face of future market downturns and less correlated to macroeconomic trends. We
are also seeing an increasing focus on cost efficiency and specialization of IT services, which is leading
companies to rely on external providers rather than developing IT in-house. For example, we have
recently been awarded a multi-vendor tender by CONSIP relating the provision of IT cloud services to
certain Italian public administrations, aimed at driving a migration from on-premises IT services to
cloud. We believe that our size and expertise in complex software, solutions and IT services compared
to some of our smaller competitors and competitors focusing on less complex products and services,


-----

position us well to benefit from such trends, which we expect to be confirmed in the mid- to long term
and that digitalization will increase and accelerate, including as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. In
addition, we believe that our combination with the Be Group enhances our positioning and our ability
to capitalize from increased IT investments by both the Italian government and the private sector.

**_Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets have strong protected local characteristics,_**
**_which advantages local players like us and creates significant barriers to entry for international_**
**_players_**

The Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets are characterized by high barriers to entry,
especially with respect to international competitors, mainly due to cultural and local commercial
complexities, such as language, local regulatory constraints in most markets including banking, energy,
and healthcare, the importance of local relationships and proximity to customers. As a result, we believe
that these barriers favor local players, thus allowing us to capitalize on our leading positioning in the
market for both traditional technologies and digital enabling technologies in Italy, given our deep
knowledge of the domestic market and long-lasting relationships with a wide cross-section of Italian
customers and partners. Italian customers have also shown to prefer software and IT services suppliers
with whom they share a common language, that have extensive operations in Italy and that have an indepth know-how of the applicable Italian legal and regulatory framework, which we believe makes
entering the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets more challenging for international
players.

**_Leading ICT Services and Software & Solutions provider in Italy with strong positions across all_**
**_industry verticals supported by deep technology expertise, strong business process knowledge and_**
**_well-established customer relationships_**

We are a leading ICT Services and Software & Solutions provider in Italy. In 2022, we were the largest
provider of Application & Infrastructure Implementation services in Italy, with a market share of
approximately 13% in terms of revenues compared to the market shares of approximately 11% and 8%
of our two closest competitors, Accenture and Reply, respectively, according to Gartner. Additionally,
in 2022, we were also one of the largest providers of Application Managed Services in Italy, with a
market share of approximately 8% in terms of revenue, compared to the market shares of approximately
24% and approximately 9% of Accenture and Reply, respectively, according to Gartner (see chart
below). We are one of the largest local players in a fragmented market where scale increasingly matters,
and we have a consistent history of market share gain. The addition of the Be Group into our business
has further consolidated this position, particularly in the markets served by our Finance industry
vertical. We believe that the Be Group is a strong player with unique and distinctive capabilities,
extending to both core areas (such as payments and CIB/capital markets), as well as emerging areas of
focus (such as data, analytics, cyber and insurance). The Be Group also provides highly defensible
consulting activities through a combination of proprietary solutions software, digital projects and endto-end vertical projects, which we expect will enable us to expand the breadth of our solutions portfolio
and enrich our Proprietary Solutions and Digitech offerings, while also allowing us to operate through
our new Consulting activities portfolio. We believe that due to a trend among our customers to
consolidate around key partners, large IT service providers such as ourselves are able to absorb a large
portion of IT spend from returning customers.

We hold leading positions across our industry verticals, which are underpinned by our broad offering
of technology solutions, local and regional regulatory knowledge, long-standing relationship with our
customers and partners, reputation for reliable delivery and cost competitiveness. The following table
provides an overview of our market share and positioning for the Application & Infrastructure

**_Verticalized offerings underpinned by leading niche proprietary software solutions, strong_**
**_technology and digital enabling capabilities, and deep understanding of business core processes_**

We believe that our solutions portfolio, by covering the full spectrum of digital enabling technologies,
is well-placed to address the digitalization trends characterizing the markets in which we operate. In the
year ended December 31, 2022, we generated 26.6% of our revenue from our activities related to
Proprietary Solutions, resulting in solid year-on-year revenue visibility as our proprietary solutions
could neither be implemented nor managed by other IT providers. Compared to the year ended
December 31, 2021, our Proprietary Solutions revenues in 2022 recorded a resilient performance. The
vast majority of revenues generated from our activities related to Proprietary Solutions is now strongly
driven by the sale of software and product-related services following the initial sale of the software
license. Our Proprietary Solutions portfolio enables us to benefit from strong competitive positions in
specific niches, particularly within the Finance, Energy & Utilities, Public Administration, Industry &
Services and Health industry verticals. Our proprietary software solutions portfolio includes four
software suite and 20 smaller products, including (i) _Grace, the leading compliance and risk_
management software program developed for financial institutions, servicing most major banks in Italy,
with a market share estimated to be double that of its closest competitor, (ii) AREAS, one of the largest
digital platforms for the digitalization and integration of clinical and administrative healthcare processes
in the hospital ERP markets and the second largest in the Italian healthcare IT market, (iii) Net@Suite,
the leading cloud-based platform for billing and CRM for all types of sales and distribution operators
in the gas and electricity markets, (iv) JEnte, one of the leading software programs for the digitalization
of processes of Italian municipalities and (v) Ellipse, a software program enabling the total digitalization
of healthcare systems by assisting clinicians in real-time diagnostics, decision and treatment activities
of their patients. Our Proprietary Solutions portfolio targets specific niches across all of our industry
verticals that are highly attractive in light of their regulated nature, the need for highly tailored solutions
and the elevated costs that customers must bear for switching providers. Furthermore, we believe that
the strong reputation of our Proprietary Solutions also allows us to up-sell and cross-sell our System
Integration and Digitech services, although we do not primarily carry out these activities in relation to
proprietary technology. In addition, our Proprietary Solutions also feature digital products including (i)


-----

_Knowage, an open source suite for modern business analytics initiatives from data visualization to deep_
analysis, (ii) _Digital Enabler, a digital platform providing a single point of data knowledge used to_
develop new value added services as well as digitally enabling older technologies and applications and
(iii) Cloudesire, our brokering and monetization platform that enables the immediate distribution of
cloud and digital services, aimed at covering a full end-to-end sell and operate capability model.
Following the completion of the Be Acquisition, our Proprietary Solutions offering has been enriched
by the Be Group’s proprietary solutions for the insurance market (including, among others, its Universo
solution for the life insurance market).

As a result of a strategic review of our business operations and positioning, we now supplement our
strong Proprietary Solutions software offering with our Digitech activities, which are aimed at providing
a cutting-edge portfolio of services for the professional customization of third-party product solutions
and, represented 36.0% of our revenue for the year ended December 31, 2022. As part of Digitech, we
offer new and advanced high-growth digital enabling capabilities designed for efficiently interacting
with the relevant third-party software, including advanced analytics, cloud-based services,
cybersecurity, customer experience, IoT, robotic process automation, AR / MR / VR and digital twin
and blockchain platforms. In addition, revenues for both our Proprietary Solutions and Digitech
portfolios are supported by our digital enabling capabilities. Moreover, through our digital services
offering, we have worked on projects including “city-as-a platform” solutions in Italy, with the aim of
increasing the degree of digitalization of the services being offered by private companies and public
entities on integrated technological platforms. We believe that our digital enabling capabilities for both
Proprietary Solutions and Digitech projects have been strengthened as a result of the integration of Be
Group’s digital division into our business, as the Be Group features an engagement hub dedicated to
the development of cutting-edge web, mobile and social media applications for customers, with a focus
on the creation and distribution of digital content and vertical digital solutions.

**_Strong focus on R&D and a highly qualified, digitally-skilled workforce_**

Innovation has always been a key element for our competitiveness and long-term sustainability. We
continuously invest in R&D and innovation to support the ongoing improvement of our organization in
increasing our competitive capacity and fulfilling the needs of a fluid, rapidly changing market. Our
investment in R&D to develop and maintain our research and project management activities has
amounted to approximately €25 million, in the year ended December 31, 2022 and, as of the date of
this Offering Memorandum, we are involved in more than 100 research projects, and our R&D Lab
department relies on a team of over 500 professionals, which includes researchers and data scientists
(both directly part of our R&D Lab department) and employees in our Development Labs, Competence
_Centers and Products Labs, who cooperate closely with our R&D Labs. We also partner with more than_
150 universities globally and have strategic alliances with several research centers globally.

We believe we are among the most active ICT research companies in Europe, attracting funds from
national and EU research programs, being ranked among the top 10 European private for profit
companies (and the first in Italy) in terms of EU funding under the European Union’s Horizon 2020
Programme for Research and Innovation. While, as of the date of this Offering Memorandum, no
official documentation has been made available yet by the European Commission, we have been
awarded research funding under the new Horizon Europe 2021-2027 Programme for over 30 initiatives
and are finalizing the grant signature process for further ten initiatives. This confirms our ability to
submit high-quality research projects, and to maintain a strong position within the European research
landscape. In the year ended December 31, 2022, we received €23 million in research funding from
Italian and European research programs.

We also deploy a significant amount of resources for the training of our technology engineers, core
process specialists and digital scientists who support our entire production cycle. Our internal “Enrico
Della Valle” IT & Management Academy, which is considered one of the leading Italian corporate
schools for IT, provides over 500 different course editions, resulting in approximately 32,000 training
days in the year ended December 31, 2022. Our academy issued approximately 1,500 certifications and


-----

trained approximately 6,000 of our employees in the year ended December 31, 2022. We believe that
our strong focus on R&D as well as the resources deployed to train our technology engineers, core
process specialists and digital scientists, coupled with our strategic acquisitions, will allow us to
continue to attract and retain skilled employees, despite the constantly increasing talent shortage in the
IT industry, which represents the key challenge in the IT sector.

**_Large and diversified customer base with highly recurring revenues and high levels of customer_**
**_satisfaction_**

We are present in all regions and most metropolitan cities in Italy (including Milan, Rome and Turin)
and operate across several sectors of the economy, including public administration, financial services,
utilities, telecommunications, transportation, infrastructure and healthcare. We have a customer base of
more than 2,750 customers, including large private and blue chip companies and public sector bodies,
among which are six of the largest Italian banks (including Intesa Sanpaolo, UniCredit and Banco
BPM), major telecommunications and media companies (including Vodafone, TIM and BT), utilities
companies (including Enel and Eni), manufacturing companies (including Stellantis), healthcare
organizations (including the Veneto region healthcare system and other large hospitals in Italy), local
public administrations (including the municipalities of Rome and Milan, as well as the IT services arm
of the Lombardy region, and the Emilia Romagna and Campania regions) and transportation and
infrastructure companies (including Ferrovie dello Stato Italiane). Following the completion of the Be
Acquisition, we believe we have further increased potential cross-selling opportunities, by leveraging
both our and Be Group’s brand recognition and strong reputation across our wide platform of customers,
while coupling our broad offer of IT services, software and digital platforms and solutions with top tier
consulting and digital services. For example, we have been deploying an end-to-end platform of
solutions aiming to address all of our customers’ IT needs, by covering the design of their IT
architecture as well as the implementation and integration of proprietary solutions and/or third-party
solutions into their systems. In addition, we benefit from a high level of exposure to medium and large
enterprise customers compared to other businesses operating within the Italian ICT sector. For the year
ended December 31, 2022, we estimate that approximately 95% of our top 50 customers are large
enterprises or public sector entities and generated 48% of our revenues, in each case after giving effect
to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies completed in 2022
(to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022.
Our business benefits from low customer concentration and significant customer diversification across
all of our industry verticals, with no customer accounting for more than 6.0% of our revenues and no
industry vertical accounting for more than 26.4% of our revenues for the year ended December 31,
2022, in each case after giving effect to the Be Acquisition as if it had been completed on January 1,
2022. For the year ended December 31, 2022, our top three customers generated approximately 16% of
our revenues, our top five customers generated approximately 22% of our revenues, and our top ten
customers generated approximately 30% of our revenues, in each case after giving effect to the Be
Acquisition as if it had been completed on January 1, 2022.

In addition, a large share of our revenues across each of our activity lines is highly recurring. In
particular, the revenues we generate from our activities related to Proprietary Solutions, accounted for
26.6% of total revenues in the year ended December 31, 2022, are highly recurring and demonstrate our


-----

long-lasting relationships with our Proprietary Solutions customers primarily as a result of the local,
highly specialized and customized nature of our Proprietary Solutions as well as their integration into
our end-customers’ IT systems, which also limits competition for our products and services in respect
of those customers. In addition, we consider the revenues we generate from our activities related to
System Integration and relating to the day-to-day management and operation services of our customers’
end-to-end infrastructure to also be recurring, as they are secured by long-term contracts. While
contractual frameworks for managed services provided as part of System Integration are usually three
to five years in length, we generally have long-term relationships with our System Integration customers
and record high levels of contract renewals. In addition, these customers display high retention rates
also due to the difficulty of switching to a different provider. Lastly, a significant portion of revenues
we generate from our activities related to Digitech is backed by high levels of contract renewals and
therefore we consider them to be recurring, also in light of our successful track record of service delivery
and our knowledge of complex IT systems.

The high share of recurring contracts with our existing customers across all of our industry verticals has
allowed us to maintain a stable revenue performance. Moreover, our ability to sell additional valueadded services to existing customers allowed us to increase spending of our existing customers over
time, thus increasing our revenue generation. After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the
acquisition by the Group of Atlantic Technologies as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022, between
January 1, 2020 and December 31, 2022, revenues generated from our top five and top ten customers
increased at CAGRs of approximately 18.4*% and 11.7*%, respectively.

**_Strong financial profile with consistent, resilient growth and cash flow generation, with further_**
**_potential to improve margin performance through cost saving initiatives_**

Over the past 20 years, our revenue expansion has been driven by mid- to high single digit organic
growth supported by continuous investments in R&D and training as well as growth from selective
value accretive acquisitions of attractive IT services assets, including, among others, our acquisitions
of Atos Origin Italia in 2008, T-Systems Italia, in 2013, Infogroup in 2017 and the Movilitas group,
Design Automation Associates, C Consulting in 2021, and PluSure S.p.A. and Atlantic Technologies
in 2022. Additionally, our revenues have remained resilient through volatile macroeconomic cycles
during the past 20 years, including through the COVID-19 pandemic, with our revenues’ organic growth
outperforming Italian GDP growth on a year-over-year basis since 2003. For the year ended December
31, 2022, we generated revenues of €1,422.6 million and Adjusted EBITDA of €207.8 million. In
addition, for the year ended ended December 31, 2022, we recorded a 4.0%* organic growth of our
revenues and, for the same period, a 19.2%* organic growth of our Adjusted EBITDA excluding the
Finance industry vertical from 2021 to 2022.

Historically, we have also been able to increase our margins as a result of continued operational
improvements and operating leverage, and we believe there is further potential to improve our margins
through operational initiatives. In particular, we have deployed several cost savings initiatives,
including (i) an initiative to streamline and optimize our workforce by facilitating turnover and filling
vacant positions with young, highly-skilled personnel coupled with an increased nearshoring presence,
(ii) the renegotiation of services and utilities contracts relating to our facilities and offices to improve
the terms thereof and (iii) other cost-saving efficiencies resulting from our company-wide transition to
smart working. Several of these measures have now been implemented in our business structure
(including, among others, few initiatives related to our procurement processes).

In addition, in 2022, as part of our ambition to implement a solid cost optimization plan, we started
implementing a comprehensive range of further cost savings and efficiency initiatives aimed at
enhancing our operations and improving our ability to respond to changes in the demand for our
products and solutions, by further increasing the flexibility of our cost structure. In the aggregate, we
expect these cost savings and efficiency initiatives to generate €16.2 million of annual run rate cost
savings by the end of 2023 (€9.8 million of which have been already achieved for the year ended
December 31, 2022), with further room for potential upside. Once achieved, we expect that these cost
savings will structurally reduce the Group’s cost base going forward. Our key cost savings and
efficiency initiatives include: (A) procurement initiatives, consisting of: (i) the streamlining of our
contractual relationships with external IT consultants through the introduction of competitive tender
procedures and a structured supplier qualification process, and (ii) the reduction of costs related to the
procurement of software products, primarily by consolidating our current software providers base into
a limited number of distributors and resellers, and consolidating our IT spend with certain selected
OEMs; (B) optimization initiatives targeting the reduction of utilities, maintenance and rent costs
related to our real estate portfolio, including the reduction of our square footage at multiple locations
and office closures in up to three out of 13 non-strategic locations in Italy as well as the opening of a
new flagship office in Milan (Italy); and (C) a broad range of other cost saving initiatives including the
outsourcing of payroll activities, the implementation of headcount optimization and reduction projects
including nearshoring in Serbia and adjacent countries, rationalization projects aimed at consolidating
our legal structure, and vendor rebate management activities.

**_Attractive consolidation platform with track record of creating value through integration of bolt-on_**
**_acquisitions_**

We believe we are a natural consolidator in the fragmented Italian ICT Services and Software &
Solutions markets and have a strong track-record of successfully integrating acquired entities, allowing
us to expand our product offering and geographic reach, generate significant cross-selling opportunities
into our existing customer base and realize synergies, while fostering future growth. Between January
2020 and December 31, 2022, we completed 9 acquisitions (including the Be Acquisition). Our M&A
strategy also relies on our ability to leverage an enhanced level of competences and stronger R&D
capabilities following the integration of acquired businesses, with the aim of reinforcing our digital
capabilities.

We constantly evaluate opportunities for prudent, highly targeted and strategic bolt-on acquisitions,
with fair acquisition prices typically funded through organic cash flow generation. Over the past five
years, we completed more than 20 bolt-on acquisitions. Past bolt-on acquisitions include (i) Cybertech
Group in 2019, which allowed us to expand our cybersecurity offering and consolidate our leadership
position in the rapidly expanding cybersecurity segment, (ii) Deus Technology in 2019, which allowed
us to expand our finance expertise with wealth management fintech solutions, (iii) Digitelematica in
2019, which allowed us to increase our e-commerce offerings to retail customers, (iv) FDL Servizi in
2020, which allowed us to expand our software solutions for smart-grid management services, (v) C
Consulting in 2021, which allowed us to strengthen our portfolio of proprietary solutions for the


-----

reinsurance market, (vi) Movilitas group in 2021, which consolidated our position in the United States
by expanding our offering of smart solutions for the manufacturing industry, (v) PluSure S.p.A. in 2022,
which allowed us to expand our product design solutions portfolio for our industry 4.0 customers, and
strengthened the positioning of our eXcellence global division on the European markets, and (vi)
Atlantic Technologies S.p.A. in 2022, which allowed us to expand our presence in the cloud technology
area of CRM, ERP and analytics. In particular, these acquisitions enabled us to significantly strengthen
our digital product and service offering in the United States, which resulted in a €56.3 million increase
in revenues generated in the United States, from €15.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2020,
to €71.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2022.

In addition, following completion of the Be Acquisition, we wholly own the Be Group, one of the
leading Italian players in the IT consulting sector and provider of business consulting, information
technology and digital business services to major financial and insurance institutions in Europe,
including Italy. As a result of the Be Acquisition, we expanded our international operations into three
new countries (Albania, Poland and Romania), while also strengthening our presence in the DACH
region (i.e., Germany, Austria and Switzerland). The successful completion of the Be Acquisition
further consolidated our leadership position in the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions
markets, in particular by enabling us to further broaden our best-in-class portfolio of consulting and
digital transformation services to customers in the markets served by our Finance industry vertical.

Through our M&A-focused team, we have developed a disciplined and clear approach to M&A activity,
targeting best-in-class specialized IT services providers with a focus on increasing our higher margin
Proprietary Solutions and Digitech portfolios, complementing our service offering and digital
capabilities by strengthening our industry-vertical specific product portfolio and thus consolidating our
leading positions across our industry verticals in order to strategically support our organic growth.

**_Strong leadership team with proven track record of delivery supported by committed Sponsors_**

Our business is supported by the experience of our senior management team, which benefits from the
experience and knowledge of our Sponsors. Following the Engineering Acquisition, highly experienced
and reputable professionals who are widely recognized for their international track record of operational

-----

Finance industry vertical, and is supported by a team that was further strengthened through the addition

**Our Strategies**

**_Continue to grow and build on our leading market position_**

We are a leading ICT services and Software and Solutions provider in Italy, with a market share of
approximately 13% in Implementation and 8% in Application Managed Services in terms of revenue in
2022, according to Gartner. Our revenues grew at a CAGR of 8.0%* (and at a CAGR of 9.5%, excluding
the results of our Finance industry vertical) between 2020 and December 31, 2022, despite the COVID19 outbreak, thereby contributing towards consolidating our market share in Italy. Excluding the results
of our Finance industry vertical, our organic revenue growth would have would have been 10.0%* over
the same period. We believe that we are uniquely positioned to continue to grow our market share by
capturing the future growth of the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets, benefitting
from increasing penetration, digitalization across all private and public sectors, and increasing spending
on new digital enabling technologies. We believe the successful completion of the Be Acquisition has
enabled us to consolidate our leadership market position in the Finance industry vertical and to grow
our market share in the Italian market and abroad. In particular, following the successful completion of
the Be Acquisition, we are operating from offices in various new countries, including in Central and
Eastern Europe, such as Albania, Poland and Romania, while also strengthening our presence in the
DACH region (i.e., Germany, Austria and Switzerland). We intend to continue to leverage our strong
technological capabilities and broad range of digital solutions which we have successfully implemented
across our activity types, industry verticals and customers to further capture opportunities to cross-sell
and up-sell our products and services. In particular, we believe that the continuing demand for our
digital enabling technologies will present us with an opportunity to further grow our market share in
Italy. Additionally, we plan to continue to center our business around the needs of our loyal customer
base, which we believe will allow us to maintain our track record of growing our digital offerings among
our top customers.

**_Strengthen our advanced technological platform, unrivalled digital capabilities and industry_**
**_partnerships complemented by the Be Group’s proprietary platforms_**

We have a strong track record of product innovation and strive to continuously develop new and tailored
digital offerings to meet our customers’ latest digital needs. Our R&D Lab, which is the core driver of
our products and services innovation process works closely with other units of the company, including
our _Innovators Network, consisting of several innovation experts who analyze market trends and_
weaknesses and translate them into ideas for innovative solutions and products, our Development Labs,
comprising a dedicated group of professionals who develop state-of-the art marketable digital
technologies, and our Products Labs, comprising a dedicated group of professionals who are devoted
to designing, developing and maintaining our proprietary solutions. Leveraging our R&D capabilities,
we intend to further strengthen our technological platform by continuing to invest in key areas, spanning
across all of our industry verticals: cybersecurity, digital industry, smart transportation, smart city, smart
government, smart energy, digital media, cloud, big data, blockchain and AI. For example, in September
2022 we started a strategic collaboration with Leonardo S.p.A., a global leader in the aerospace, defence
& security sector, to identify projects and business opportunities to be developed jointly in the field of
Digital Transformation and Cybersecurity with a particular focus on the defense, healthcare, finance,
public administration and infrastructure sectors, including through joint R&D initiatives. In addition,
following the successful completion of the Be Acquisition, we have enriched our portfolio of proprietary
solutions, strengthening in particular our positioning as a key provider of services to the broader finance
industry.


-----

We also intend to further capitalize on our strong, long-standing relationships with key strategic
partners, who comprise next-generation technology vendors and service providers and include
worldwide leaders in public cloud and SaaS services, such as Amazon Web Services, Google and
Microsoft, ERP and CRM solutions, such as SAP, Oracle, Salesforce and Microsoft, as well as a large
pool of digital technologies providers, such as Adobe, Cisco, RedHat and VMware. We believe that our
focus on strong relationships with key industry partners will continue to allow us to provide our
customers with access to cutting-edge digital platforms and solutions. To that end, in April 2023, we
entered into a binding commitment for a partnership in respect of the digital platform of Illimity, an
established banking digital platform, including exclusive distribution rights relating to such platform
for our Finance industry vertical until 2032. This partnership is currently expected to generate
contractual revenues of €15 million per year until 2032 for the professional services that we are expected
to provide in connection with the distribution of Illimity’s platform to third parties, while also unlocking
potential upsides driven by our exclusive distribution rights, all of which remains subject to the
finalization of the long-form partnership terms, which is expected by the end of June 2023. The total
consideration for the partnership is €55.5 million (which may be increased by €4.5 million between
2024 and 2032), which will be paid in the period from 2023 to 2026, with approximately €10.0 million
paid in 2023 and funded by cash on hand.

**_Increase our offering of Proprietary Solutions and Digitech_**

We believe that our large portfolio of leading, niche vertical proprietary solutions and services supports
our strong reputation as a leading ICT services and Software and Solutions provider in Italy and acts as
a catalyst for our broad service offerings across our industry verticals. Our portfolio of Proprietary
Solutions, which primarily targets customers in our Finance, Energy & Utilities, Public Administration,
Industry & Services and Health industry verticals, has also historically contributed to our strong margins
and highly sticky, recurring revenue from long-term, strategic customer relationships.

In addition to our Proprietary Solutions portfolio, we believe that our reputation and market positioning
are complemented by our portfolio of highly customized Digitech solutions, which we believe allows
us to cover the full spectrum of digital enabling technologies and continue to deliver cutting-edge highsolutions to our customers, capable of being integrated with both third-party and client-owned
applications.

We also intend to continue leveraging our in-house R&D capabilities and developing digital enabling
proprietary solutions to the activities we conduct in relation to Proprietary Solutions. Among others,
our existing portfolio includes Eng-DE4Bios, a system empowered by digital enabling technologies to
integrate and harmonize data available to local government and healthcare systems in Veneto, allowing
for the identification of incidences of COVID-19 infections across a defined territory. We are also
developing selected POC projects to be deployed in the metaverse space, focusing on the following

a strategic partnership agreement with Novartis Italia, leader in the medical-scientific research, for the
development of initiatives and solutions aimed at responding to the challenges of “Mission 6” of the
PNRR by accelerating the digital transition of the Italian healthcare system through the introduction of

contractor. The platform will be entirely cloud-based and will ensure interoperability and integration.
In particular, the PNT aims to connect the central administration with local administrations, favoring
the centralized governance and monitoring of telemedicine processes implemented at the regional level,
in line with “Mission 6” of the PNRR.

targeting the reduction of utilities, maintenance and rent costs related to our real estate portfolio,

In addition, we believe that our combination with the Be Group will deliver significant value generation,
