**Our History**

We were founded by Michele Cinaglia, in 1980 in Padua as part of the Cerved group. Over the course
of 40 years, we have grown both organically and through acquisitions to become the leading specialist
provider of IT services, software and digital platforms in Italy.

Following a management buyout in 1984, we became a standalone entity and continued to grow
organically and through strategic acquisitions within the public and financial services sectors until our
initial public offering and listing on the Electronic Share Market (Mercato Telematico Azionario or
MTA) organized and managed by Borsa Italiana in 2000. Between 2001 and 2005, we further expanded
our operations in Italy through various strategic bolt-on acquisitions, including the acquisition of
OverIT, a company focused on the optimization of field processes with cutting-edge technologies
(which we spun off in 2021), Nexen, an IT consulting firm for both traditional and new technologies,
including robotic process automation, big data, cloud, open banking and AI, and Olivetti Sanità, a
leading IT provider of services for the healthcare industry. In 2008, through the acquisition of Atos
Origin Italia, an international IT services company, we reinforced our capacities to deliver high quality
and innovative IT services to customers in the infrastructure industry. We subsequently continued our
geographic expansion into the United States, through the acquisition of Dynpro, a company specialized
in software design and development, managed services, IT consulting and IT staffing. We reinforced
our presence in the market for mobile applications through the acquisition of Xaltia, a company
providing value added services on mobile platforms, offering mobile applications and content
development. We also expanded into Germany, through the acquisition of DST Consulting GmbH, a
digitalization specialist operating throughout Germany with more than 300 employees in twelve
locations. In 2008, we established a subsidiary in Brazil to support our customer TIM in its expansion
into Brazil. In 2013, we also completed the strategic acquisition of the Italian branch of T-Systems, a
global IT services and consulting company, consolidating our presence in Italy.

Following our take-private by NB Renaissance (NBRP Fund I, NBRP Annex and co-investors) and
Apax in 2016, we continued to grow our business, product and IT services offering organically and
through strategic acquisitions, such as our acquisition of Infogroup in 2017, a company specialized in
IT services for the financial industry in Germany and other German- language countries, Cybertech
Group in 2019, which allowed us to expand our cyber technology offering, and Deus Technology in
2019, which allowed us to expand our offerings with wealth management fintech solutions. In 2020,
we completed the acquisition of FDL Servizi, a company providing software for smart gridmanagement.

In July 2020, we were acquired by the Sponsors with the aim to strengthen our leading position, product
and IT service offering in Italy and continue to support our principal Italian clients as they grow
internationally. In 2021, we completed several additional acquisitions in Italy and abroad. In Italy, we
acquired the smart working and collaboration platform for businesses from Livebox S.r.l., Nexera
S.p.A., a company specializing in the provision of IT solutions for advanced security systems and
healthcare through proprietary solutions, as well as C Consulting S.p.A., a company operating in the
reinsurance market, which enabled us to both enrich our product portfolio dedicated to financial
institutions and insurance companies through high quality proprietary solutions and to expand our IFRS
and Solvency II consulting capabilities. In addition, we significantly expanded our footprint in the
United States through the acquisition of a business unit of Design Automation Associates Inc., a digital
automation player focusing on product design, analysis and test engineering, and the Movilitas Group,
an established U.S. player in the consulting space offering smart solutions for the manufacturing
industry which enhanced our industry 4.0 offering in the areas of product tracking and tracing, digital
twin, asset performance management and warehouse management. As part of our growth strategy, in
2021 we also completed the spin-off of our subsidiary OverIT S.p.A., which has exited the consolidation
perimeter of the Group with effect from December 1, 2021. In 2022, we continued to strengthen our
portfolio by completing the acquisition of PluSure S.p.A., an Italian company specialized in product
lifecycle management solutions, which allowed us to expand our product design solutions portfolio for
our industry 4.0 customers, and strengthened the positioning of our eXcellence global division on the


-----

European markets. In addition, in 2022 we completed the acquisition of Atlantic Technologies S.p.A.,
an Italian company specialized in implementing cloud technology in the area of CRM, ERP and
analytics. See “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition of Operations—Key
_Factors Affecting Results of Operations and Financial Condition—Acquisitions and Disposals.”_

In July 2022, we entered into the Be Acquisition Agreement and on the First Be Acquisition Closing
Date, we completed the Initial Acquisition. Between the First Be Acquisition Closing Date and
December 28, 2022, we acquired all the remaining shares of Be through the Market Purchases, the
Mandatory Offer and the Squeeze-Out. As a result, as of the date of this Offering Memorandum we
wholly own the Be Group. The Be Group is one of the leading Italian players in the IT consulting sector
and provides business consulting, information technology and digital business services to major
financial and insurance institutions in Europe, including Italy. We believe that the Be Acquisition
enabled us to create a strong industrial combination and to further consolidate our strong position in the
markets served by our Finance industry vertical as well as our end-to-end capabilities, given Be Group’s
large addressable market, underpinned by strong underlying market trends and a large customer base.
See “—Our Business—The Be Group.”

**Our Business**

**_Activities_**

Following a strategic review of our business operations and positioning, beginning on January 1, 2022,
we offer our IT services, software and digital platforms to our customers by engaging in three distinct
activity types: Proprietary Solutions, Digitech and System Integration. Compared to our former
activities split, our Proprietary Solutions portfolio has remained substantially unchanged (the main
difference being the impact of the spin-off of our subsidiary OverIT in 2021) and encompasses all
solutions embedding software products for which we retain exclusive ownership (regardless of whether
such solutions relate to high technological or traditional products), while our previous allocation of
services and products between Application Transformation and Managed Services has been further
refined to reflect our new strategy in targeting customers by activity types to achieve competitive
advantages. In particular, through our new Digitech activities we aim to consolidate our entire portfolio
of professional IT solutions for high-technology third-party products into a new comprehensive hub,
while through our new System Integration activities we aim to focus on offering solutions for the
management of traditional IT systems and customer infrastructure, thereby enhancing our support
capabilities. Moreover, following the completion of the Be Acquisition, we offer a large portion of Be’s
products and solutions portfolio through a fourth separate activity types, (iv) Consulting, while the
remaining portion of Be’s portfolio has been allocated to, and is offered as part of, our existing three
activities.

We believe that our activities distinction enables us to separate our high-growth Digitech offering from
the customized, end-to-end Proprietary Solutions offerings that we develop for individual customers
and from the IT services, including third-party, that we provide and manage on behalf of our customers
through our activities relating to System Integration.

_Proprietary Solutions_

Our activities relating to Proprietary Solutions include a wide range of cutting-edge, customized, endto-end IT services, such as industry-specific, innovative vertical software and related services. We often
develop our Proprietary Solutions software products in cooperation with our customers and tailor them
to address our customers’ specific needs. Typically, we retain exclusive ownership of these products
and we make them available to the customers with whom they have been developed on the basis of
individually negotiated licensing and subscription agreements that limit their ability to license out or
modify such products as well as to use other competing software products. In addition, our Proprietary
Solutions products portfolio consists in significantly customized and highly specialized products and
services that we integrate into our end-customers’ IT systems. As part of our activities related to


-----

Proprietary Solutions we provide day-to-day management services with respect to our proprietary
products, including consulting services, service desks and help desk support.

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated approximately 26.6% of our revenues from our
activities related to Proprietary Solutions.

_Digitech_

Our activities relating to Digitech comprise the development and customization of high-growth digital
enabling solutions using advanced analytics, cloud, cybersecurity, customer experience, IoT, robotic
process automation, AR / MR / VR, digital twin and blockchain technologies in cooperation with our
partners, including, among others, Microsoft, Google, Amazon, SAS, IBM and Oracle. In addition,
Digitech includes activities related to strategic partnerships with major software vendors including,
among others, Salesforce and SAP. We provide our Digitech activities on the basis of software and
other technological products that are non-proprietary, with the aim of offering highly customized
solutions capable of being integrated with both third-party and client-owned applications. In particular,
we provide our customers with (i) application development services, through which we create, maintain
and manage customized applications and (ii) integration services, through which we develop, manage
and integrate software and applications of some of the most advanced global IT technology providers
(including Microsoft, SAP and Salesforce) into our customers’ systems and provide related consultancy
and design services. In addition, as part of our Digitech portfolio we support, maintain and update third
party applications and offer project-based system integration services for customers as well as software
providers. Following the acquisition of Atlantic Technologies in 2022, we offer its services as part of
our Digitech portfolio.

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated approximately 36.0% of our revenue from our
activities related to Digitech.

_System Integration_

Our activities relating to System Integration comprise integration services related to the
implementation, management and maintenance of traditional IT solutions, as well as day-to-day
management and operation services of our customers’ end-to-end infrastructure (including, among
others, hosting and desktop management activities). In addition, our System Integration activities
portfolio comprises other specialized services, such as complex information systems, customized
system architectures and applications integration services for both new or existing hardware and
software.

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated approximately 32.4% of our revenue from our
activities related to System Integration.

_Consulting_

Following the completion of the Be Acquisition, we offer a large portion of the Be Group’s products
and solutions portfolio through our new activity line, Consulting. In particular, our Consulting activities
comprise the business consulting, information technology and digital business services offered by the
Be Group, mainly to major financial and insurance institutions in Europe, including Italy. See “—The
_Be Group.”_

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated approximately 5.0% of our revenue from our
activities related to Consulting.

**_Industry Verticals_**

We operate each of our activity types across six distinct industry verticals, each of which is described
in detail below. Our flexible structure and well-diversified products and services offering enable us to


-----

cross-sell to our customers in different industry verticals (for example, our cybersecurity and cloud
services are sold across all of our industry verticals). In addition, in 2022 we started implementing a
strategic initiative focusing on the consolidation of our Energy & Utilities, Industry & Services and
Telco & Media industry verticals into a new business unit, “Enterprise,” with the aim to strengthen our
role in rapidly evolving markets. In addition, for internal reporting purposes, in 2023 we consolidated
our Health and Public Administration industry verticals into our new “Public Sector” business unit. In
particular, we believe that through “Enterprise” we will increase the coordination between our industry
verticals, while unlocking the ability to develop high-quality digital systems for the delivery of crossdomain solutions.

_Finance_

Leveraging on our strong regulatory and market knowledge as well as our integrated offering of AI,
advanced analytics, cybersecurity, robotic process automation, cloud, digital twin, blockchain and
digital workplace, we offer customers in our Finance Industry vertical IT services relating to funds
administration, payments and settlements, regulatory compliance, risk management and credit
management. Through the provision of these services and technologies we assist our customers in
transforming data, managing processes, transitioning into open ecosystems, and optimizing internal
processes to reduce friction. For example, in recent years, we have assisted and continue to assist several
financial institutions in connection with the increasing digitalization of their processes and activities
following the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic, which has resulted in the upscaling of their
innovation efforts and the review of their existing organizational models.

Our Proprietary Solutions offering in our Finance industry vertical comprises four distinct product
suites: (i) application infrastructure, data management, governance, risk, regulatory and compliance,
(ii) digital customers and credit (iii) digital advisory and sales and (iv) digital payments and settlements.
Our proprietary product offering within the application infrastructure, data management, governance,
risk, regulatory and compliance product suite includes infrastructure services that allow our customers
to better understand their data and increase the reliability of their data-driven practices such as μSE, a
software program used to create solutions that comply with the EU Open Platform Regulatory
Directives, Grace, one of the leading compliance and risk management software programs developed
for financial institutions and DATÆLL, a software program that uses a shared data model to process
customers’ big data (or “data lake”), distilling information from such data while also managing both
traditional and AI and machine learning cognitive algorithms. Our proprietary product offering within
the digital customers and credit product suite includes Claps, a modular software solution for the
management of end-to-end credit processes through digital transformation and process automation. The
proprietary products that we offer within the digital advisory and sales product suite include T1, a multiobjective consultancy platform for the financial, insurance, and credit sectors which aims to offer end
customers a global vision of their current and future needs and also includes a robo-advisory services
platform for the automated and algorithmic management of investments portfolios. The proprietary
products that we offer within the digital payments and settlements product suite include Hycards, a
consolidated software hub for the management of membership cards, loyalty programs and for the
optimization of relationships with customers. In addition, our proprietary solution XLayers provides a
comprehensive package enabling end-to-end management of all inbound and outbound reinsurance
processes, as well as management services covering the full spectrum of related cessions and
retrocessions.

The activities we conduct in relation to Digitech in our Finance industry vertical include the
development, customization and integration of digital software and digital solutions in the areas of
regulatory compliance, cybersecurity, customer experience, risk management and governance, as well
as digital services, such as banking and insurance, instant payments, eVending and crowdfunding.

Our System Integration activities in our Finance industry vertical include the provision of infrastructure
services and call-center support activities as well as integration services for traditional IT solutions.


-----

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated revenues of €291.7 million, or 21% of our total
revenues, and Adjusted EBITDA of €57.0 million, or 27% of our total Adjusted EBITDA, from the
Finance industry vertical.

Following completion of the Be Acquisition, we integrated a large portion of the Be Group’s product
and solutions portfolio into the offering of our Finance industry vertical. After giving effect to the Be
Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies completed in 2022 (to the
extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022, we
estimate that the revenues of the Be Group allocated to our Finance industry vertical would have
comprised approximately 50% of the aggregated revenues of the Group generated by the Finance
industry vertical in the year ended December 31, 2022. In addition, after giving effect to the Be
Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies completed in 2022 (to the
extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on January 1, 2022, we
estimate that for the year ended December 31, 2022, revenue from the Finance industry vertical would
have represented approximately 29% of the aggregated revenues of the Group. For a description of Be’s
business, see “—Our Business—The Be Group.”

_Health_

In our Health industry vertical, we provide hospitals and other organizations in the healthcare industry
with a variety of Proprietary Solutions, such as AREAS, a proprietary platform for the digitalization
and integration of clinical and administrative healthcare processes and Ellipse, a software program
enabling the total digitalization of healthcare systems by assisting clinicians in real-time diagnostics,
decision and treatment activities of their patients.

The activities we conduct in relation to Digitech in our Health industry vertical include the development
and customization of software and digital solutions in the areas of clinical and administrative
governance, diagnostics, clinical treatment and care as well as prevention. Additionally, we offer our
customers other innovative IT services and applications, such as tele-health, patient relationship
management and cybersecurity. On occasion, we engage in these activities together with our partners,
which are typically small, local partners that we identify on an ad hoc basis to integrate our product and
service offering. We also manage various support activities, including accounting, finance and logistics,
for healthcare facilities in multiple Italian regions, including Sardinia, Veneto, Emilia Romagna,
Marche, Toscana and Lazio. We leveraged our ability to serve customers across different industry
verticals from one integrated platform with the creation of Digital Enabler, a data- and cloud-native bio
surveillance system, which we named Eng-DE4Bios. While being initially designed as a smart city
platform for monitoring air pollution and lighting, following the COVID-19 outbreak Eng-DE4Bios has
been redesigned in order to utilize our digital enabling technologies to integrate and harmonize data
available to local government and healthcare systems in Veneto, allowing for the identification of
incidences of COVID-19 infections across a defined territory, and thereby enabling healthcare
authorities to weigh responses and impose targeted lockdown and other restrictive measures. EngDE4Bios also carries out predictive analysis to identify where COVID-19 infections are most likely to
spread, allowing for the optimal allocation of scarce healthcare resources. We believe that EngDE4Bios can potentially be employed to carry out predictive analysis on additional, different datasets.
Furthermore, we assisted Regione Lombardia, Regione Toscana and Regione Puglia with the
implementation and management of their COVID-19-vaccination online platforms.

Our System Integration in our Health industry vertical include clinical assistance and emergency
management.

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated revenues of €117.0 million, or 8% of our total
revenues, and Adjusted EBITDA of €25.6 million, or 12% of our total Adjusted EBITDA, from the
Health industry vertical.


-----

After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies
completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on
January 1, 2022, we estimate that for the year ended December 31, 2022, revenue from the Health
industry vertical would have represented approximately 7% of the aggregated revenues of the Group.

_Industry & Services_

We provide a wide range of IT and outsourcing services and technologies to customers across various
industries, including the manufacturing, retail, fashion, agriculture and transportation industries.

In our Industry & Services industry vertical, our Proprietary Solutions offering includes Dive Suite, an
innovative IoT digital platform for asset integration, performance monitoring and predictive analysis
for the manufacturing and transportation industries and DDP, an all-inclusive digital platform
supporting leading automotive dealerships in the management of their businesses. Our proprietary
solutions and applications for the automotive market also include applications for monitoring
compliance with CO2 emission regulations, smart mobility and environmental sustainability. We also
support manufacturers and retailers in digitalizing the entire manufacturing process, from product
design and simulation to production execution, control and monitoring with proprietary applications
and platforms such as My Clienteling, a mobile app dedicated to store staff that is aimed at increasing
customer knowledge, loyalty and sales, which we are currently expanding in order to enable its
deployment in metaverse scenarios. We also help retailers and fashion companies to revolutionize the
customer shopping experience and, at the same time, streamline their operations, reduce costs and
increase revenues with software such as MARKETSUITE, a platform by Digitelematica, one of our
subsidiaries, providing e-commerce and digital distribution solutions for large supermarkets and
hypermarkets. In the agriculture industry, we have developed technologies to analyze microclimates
and identify environmental factors that can optimize crop development and prevent the spread of plant
diseases, which have been implemented to assist customers such as the Maison Anselmet winery in
maintaining the yield of their highest value vineyard despite adverse climactic conditions.

The activities we conduct in relation to Digitech in our Industry & Services include the development
and customization of software and digital solutions in the areas of (i) smart transportation, infrastructure
and mobility, covering services such as automation and control systems, diagnostic and maintenance
systems, data analytics and safety systems, and (ii) digitalization of the manufacturing process, digital
twins, covering services such as planning and forecasting, sourcing and manufacturing, delivery and
supply as well as customer engagement and sales. Following the acquisition of Atlantic Technologies
in 2022, we offer its services as part of our Industry & Services industry vertical.

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated revenues of €374.9 million, or 26% of our total
revenues, and Adjusted EBITDA of €42.0 million, or 20% of our total Adjusted EBITDA, from the
Industry & Services industry vertical.

After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies
completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on
January 1, 2022, we estimate that for the year ended December 31, 2022, revenue from the Industry &
Services industry vertical would have represented approximately 22% of the aggregated revenues of
the Group.

_Telco & Media_

We provide our telecommunication and media customers with a complete range of IT technologies for
BSS and OSS solutions and we have entered into exclusivity agreements for certain IT services with
some of the major telecommunication companies in Italy, such as TIM, Vodafone and BT.

Our Proprietary Solutions offering in the Telco & Media vertical includes _Mobile VAS, one of the_
leading platforms in Italy for in-cloud management services enabling mobile operators to sell value

-----

added products and services to their subscribers, Gateway SMS, a software allowing users to send or
receive SMS or MMS, and Mobile Payment Platform, a software allowing users to process mobile
payments. We also own proprietary payment rails, which are operated through sim cards or phone bills.

The activities we conduct in relation to Digitech in the Telco & Media vertical include the development
and customization of software and digital solutions in the areas of BSS and OSS, revenue assurance
and fraud management, HR and financial management as well as digital payment solutions. Our main
contracts relating to Digitech include those with TIM, Open Fiber and Sparkle.

Our System Integration in the Telco & Media vertical includes help desk services and network
management such as DWH and big data, billing and grid management. Our main contracts relating to
System Integration include those with BT for infrastructure outsourcing.

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated revenues of €115.1 million, or 8% of our total
revenues, and Adjusted EBITDA of €11.4 million, or 6% of our total Adjusted EBITDA, from the Telco
& Media industry vertical.

After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies

Group.

_Energy & Utilities_

Leveraging on our strong regulatory and market knowledge, we provide customers in our Energy &
Utilities vertical, including those operating in the oil, power, gas, commodities, water, waste and heating
sectors, with IT services and technologies along the entire energy and utilities value chain.

Our Proprietary Solutions offering in our Energy & Utilities vertical includes Net@SIU, a software
addressing metering-to-cash management and Net@CRM, a software addressing customer
management, which are part of the Net@Suite, a cloud-based platform serving all types of sales and
distribution operators in the gas and electric energy markets.

The activities we conduct in relation to Digitech in our Energy & Utilities vertical include the
development and customization of software and digital solutions across the entire energy and utilities
value chain. For example, we have worked with SAP to develop solutions for ENI and ENEL, a utility
service management application utilized by several of the largest utilities providers in Italy. Our main
contracts relating to Digitech include those with Enel for the support of core business processes of their
networks and infrastructures and for the updating of Enel’s meters to new generation meters.

Our System Integration in our Energy & Utilities vertical include help desk services and network
management. Our main contract relating to System Integration in Energy & Utilities sector is with Enel
for the management of one of its new generation environmentally friendly data centers.

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated revenues of €209.0 million, or 15% of our total

_Public Administration_

We provide a wide range of IT services, technologies and business process outsourcing solutions to our
customers in the public sector, including municipalities, such as services and products for the
development and management of their core processes in many of the areas that public administrations
are active in.

Our Proprietary Solutions offering in our Public Administration vertical includes proprietary software
such as Municipia, our platform for the management of taxes, tariffs and fines, Ekovision, a digital
platform for smart collection of waste and the management of transportation services, INES Cloud, a
digital platform for access, traffic and parking management, JEnte, one of the leading software for the
digitalization of processes of Italian municipalities and Digital Enabler, a digital platform providing a
single point of data knowledge used to develop new value added services, Sicer, an ERP platform for
local authorities, integrating financial accounting, economic patrimonial and analytical accounting,
Auriga, a platform for the digitalization and optimization of document management processes and
administrative procedures, and Knowage, an open source suite for modern business analytics initiatives
from data visualization to deep analysis, as well as digitally enabling older technologies and
applications. We also provide a wide range of traditional and innovative IT services and applications in
the fields of environment risk management, decision support systems, digital payments, application
program interface platform management, audit, risk and compliance.

The activities we conduct in relation to Digitech in our Public Administration industry vertical include
the development and customization of digital solutions in the areas of sustainability (waste and energy
consumption management), security (including security management and analytics for cybersecurity),
mobility (including smart mobility and traffic fine management and traffic monitoring), interactivity
(including asset management, ERP and document management) and welfare (including local economy
development and social care management). We typically engage in these activities together with our
partners, which include small and medium innovative companies and certain large facility management
players. We also provide a variety of IT services in the areas of military intelligence (including security
and intelligence systems), defense (including command support systems and military document
management systems), and maritime, space and homeland security (including maritime safety systems,
earth observation applications and border control systems). In addition, we support the digital
transformation of a large number of regional administrations, including the (i) welfare and employment
management systems of Emilia Romagna, Veneto, Umbria, Valle d’Aosta, Calabria, Lazio and the
province of Trento, (ii) the funds management systems of Emilia Romagna, Veneto, Lazio and Toscana,
(iii) the agriculture management systems of Veneto, Emilia Romagna, Lombardia and Piemonte, and
(iv) systems for the management, control and monitoring of the use of land resources for Sardegna,
Piemonte, Emilia Romagna and Calabria.

Our System Integration in the Public Administration industry vertical include smart cities management,
census management, e-government, tax and revenue management, financial management, electronic
payment, electronic invoicing, document management and healthcare management as well as data
infrastructure. We are not required to obtain any regulatory authorizations to provide these services.

In the year ended December 31, 2022, we generated revenues of €314.9 million, or 22% of our total
revenues, and Adjusted EBITDA of €43.3 million, or 21% of our total Adjusted EBITDA, from the
Public Administration industry vertical.

After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies

January 1, 2022, we estimate that for the year ended December 31, 2022, revenue from the Public
Administration industry vertical would have represented approximately 22% of the aggregated revenues
of the Group.

**_The Be Group_**

As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, we own, through Overlord Bidco, 100% of Be’s share
capital.

Founded in 1987, the Be Group is one of the leading Italian players in the IT consulting sector and is
listed on the Euronext STAR Milan segment of the Euronext Milan market. The Be Group provides
highly specialized, quality business consulting, information technology and digital business services
mainly to major banks and insurance institutions, processors and other financial services institutions in
Europe, including Italy, through the following three operating segments organized to provide
specialized vertical support:

##  Business Consulting: Be Group’s business consulting activities focus on advisory and consultancy
services supporting the financial services industry in the implementation of business strategies
and/or the deployment of plans for internal innovation. In particular, Be Group’s specialist skills in
this segment are aimed at assisting its customers in the areas of payment systems, planning &
control methods, regulatory compliance, information gathering and corporate governance solutions
for financial processes and asset management. For the year ended December 31, 2022, the Be Group
generated approximately 76.9% of its revenues from activities related to Business Consulting.
Following the successful completion of the Be Acquisition, Be’s portfolio of services offered as
part of its Business Consulting operating segment has been allocated to, and is offered as part of,
our Consulting activity type.

##  Information Technology Solutions: through this segment, the Be Group focuses on offering ICT
consulting and system integration products, platforms and technology solutions services for
specialized segment-leading applications, also by leveraging on own proprietary products and
platforms. For the year ended December 31, 2022, the Be Group generated approximately 17.6%
of its revenues from activities related to Information Technology Solutions. Following the
successful completion of the Be Acquisition, a portion of Be’s Information Technology Solutions
has been integrated into our System Integration activities.

##  Digital Business Services: Be Group’s digital business segment focuses on assisting customers in
the implementation of digital transformation solutions, particularly in the areas of system
integration and user and customer experience, including through the deployment of new revenue
models. Be Group’s offer in this segment features an engagement hub dedicated to the development
of cutting-edge web, mobile and social media applications for customers, with a focus on the
creation and distribution of digital content and vertical digital solutions, in addition to vertical
digital solutions for human mobility. For the year ended December 31, 2022, the Be Group
generated approximately 5.6% of its revenues from activities related to Digital Business Services.
Following the successful completion of the Be Acquisition, a portion of Be’s Digital Business
Services has been integrated into our Digitech activities.

The Be Group is a strong player with unique capabilities, and benefits from solid underlying market
dynamics. The Be Group focuses on core practices such as payments and CIB/capital markets, in
addition to emerging practices such as data, analytics and cyber and insurance, and its customer base is
characterized by long-term, sticky relationships. Be Group’s customers include primarily major
financial and insurance institutions, such as Unipol, Lloyd’s, UniCredit S.p.A., Intesa Sanpaolo S.p.A.,
Deutsche Bank, Mediobanca, Banco BPM S.p.A., HSBC, MasterCard, Poste Italiane S.p.A. and Nexi
S.p.A., along with Italian industrial players (including Eni). In addition, the Be Group customer
portfolio reflects high-profile public institutions, including the governmental Agency for Digital Italy
(Agenzia per l’Italia Digitale) and the German central bank (Deutsche Bundesbank). As of December
31, 2022, the Be Group employed nearly 1,934 employees across 19 offices throughout 12 countries,
including Italy and Central and Eastern European countries, such as Albania, Poland and Romania.
Between 2020 and 2022, the Be Group’s revenues grew at a CAGR of approximately 14%,
underpinning a track record of growth and profitability.

Following the successful completion Be Acquisition, we have integrated a large portion of the Be
Group’s product and solutions portfolio into the offering of our Finance industry vertical, while the
remaining portion of Be group’s portfolio has been allocated to, and is offered as part of, our Public
Administration and Industry & Services industry verticals. As regards the integration with our activity
types, following the successful completion of the Be Acquisition, we have integrated portions of Be
Group’s solutions into our Proprietary Solutions portfolio (including, among others, Be Group’s
proprietary digital platforms), Digitech portfolio (including, among others, certain of Be Group’s ICT
solutions), and System Integration portfolio (including, among others, the activities of Be’s subsidiary
Be Digitech Solutions S.p.A.). We also established a new activity line, Consulting, which will comprise
the business consulting, information technology and digital business services offered by the Be Group.
In addition, pursuant to the Be Reinvestment and Shareholders Agreement, following the successful
completion of the Be Acquisition, we agreed to (i) transfer certain ICT business activities of Be to the
Group by carving out Be’s subsidiary Be Digitech Solutions S.p.A. (excluding its advisory business
unit) and integrate such activities into our Digitech portfolio, and (ii) identify a new potential “Digital
Engagement Activities” commercial unit as part of the integration of Be’s digital activities into our
digital portfolio. As of the date of the Offering Memorandum, these transactions have not yet been
completed. We believe that the completion of the Be Acquisition consolidates our role as a strategic
digital enabler, specifically by creating a strong industrial combination and enhancing our position in
the markets served by our Finance industry vertical.

We believe that the successful completion of the Be Acquisition has further consolidated our leadership
position in the Italian ICT Services and Software & Solutions markets, in particular by enabling us to
further broaden our best-in-class portfolio of consulting and digital transformation services to customers
in the markets served by our Finance industry vertical. We plan to leverage Be Group’s specialization
in management consulting solutions, in order to strengthen our vast portfolio of proprietary solutions
and digital capabilities in the Finance industry vertical. Following the completion of the Be Acquisition,
the Be Group has maintained a degree of autonomy within our Group, and focuses its operations towards
providing management consulting services connected to modern digital transformation processes. In


-----

addition, the Be Group also continues to offer cutting-edge solutions in partnership with leading
international solution vendors.

**Customers**

We have a large and diversified customer base of more than 2,750 customers, including large private
and blue chip companies and public sector bodies. We also serve small and medium sized enterprises
as well as other micro-businesses. Our business benefits from low customer concentration and
significant customer diversification across all of our industry verticals, with no customer accounting for
more than 6.0% of our revenues and no industry vertical accounting for more than 26.4% of our
revenues, in each case, in the year ended December 31, 2022 (without giving effect of the spin-off of
OverIT). We serve our customers through operations covering 20 countries worldwide including major
European countries (such as Belgium, France, Germany, Spain, Switzerland and the United Kingdom),
the United States and Latin American countries, such as Brazil. For the year ended December 31, 2022,
we generated 18.3% of our revenues outside of Italy. Moreover, following the completion of the Be
Acquisition, we strengthened our international operations, as we offer Be Group’s products and services
in three additional new countries (Poland, Romania and Albania), and increased our presence in
Germany, Austria and Switzerland.

We seek to create long-term, strategic relationships with our customers, and aim to become an integral
part of their businesses. We benefit from long-lasting customer relationships, with an average tenure of
more than ten years, and a significant degree of customer loyalty, built on our track-record of costeffective service delivery and customized proprietary solutions, local regulatory and market knowledge
as well as know-how of complex IT architectures. We are consistently recognized as one of the best
partners in terms of product personalization and contractual terms in Italy and more than 96% of our
customers were “very satisfied,” “satisfied” or “neutral” about our product offering and services in
2022, according to a customer satisfaction survey that we perform every year on approximately 170
customers across all of our industry verticals. In the year ended December 31, 2022, our top ten
customers accounted for approximately 30% of our revenues, after giving effect to the Be Acquisition
as if it had been completed on January 1, 2022.

In the Finance industry vertical, we primarily serve banking, insurance, capital markets and other

In the Public Administration industry vertical, we primarily serve municipalities and local public

-----

overall average relationship tenure in the Public Administration industry vertical is approximately ten

In the Health industry vertical, we serve large providers of healthcare services, including various

**Material Contracts**

Our contracts have terms that differ depending on whether we are contracting with public or private
sector customers. The following is an overview of the typical structures of our public and private sector
customer contracts, along with summaries of some of our key contracts.

**_Public sector contracts_**

The majority of our contractual relationships within the public sector are governed by framework
agreements that are awarded by appointed public procurement bodies pursuant to competitive public
tenders. A framework agreement is typically granted to one or more suppliers, or to a consortium of
suppliers, based on a selection process involving an economic and technical evaluation of bids. Each
framework agreement sets forth a catalogue of products and services that the supplier can provide and
the terms governing the provision of such products and services over the duration of the framework
agreement, including the maximum quantity and value of products and services to be provided.
Throughout the duration of the framework agreement, the appointed procurement bodies may submit
individual purchase orders to the suppliers for products and services. The duration of framework
agreements typically ranges from two to five years with an option for the customer to extend the
agreement by an additional year at the end of the framework period.

After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies
completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on
January 1, 2022, our largest customer and our top ten customers in the public sector accounted for
approximately 2.0% and 11.8%, respectively, of our revenues for the year ended December 31, 2022.


-----

Generally, public sector contracts do not include automatic price adjustments mechanisms, including in
relation to inflation.

**_Private sector contracts_**

In the private sector, our contracts are generally awarded based on competitive bidding, with key terms
varying depending on the services rendered. In the IT Services area, the typical contract duration is
shorter compared to our public sector contracts and between one and two years, with fee structures
ranging from daily fees and as-a-service fees to on-premises license fees. Performance under our IT
services contracts is generally measured on the basis of response, delivery and troubleshooting times
and service availability. Generally, private sector contracts feature renewal clauses, but do not include
automatic price adjustments mechanisms, including in relation to inflation.

After giving effect to the Be Acquisition and the acquisition by the Group of certain other companies
completed in 2022 (to the extent not already reflected in the Group’s results) as if they had occurred on
January 1, 2022, our largest customer and our top ten customers in the private sector accounted for 5.8%
and 27.5%, respectively, of our revenues for the year ended December 31, 2022.

**Suppliers and Partners**

We have strong relationships with more than 50 major IT and software companies such as Amazon
Web Services, Google, Microsoft, RedHut, Dynatrace, Oracle, Salesforce, Tipco and Vmware. We rely
on many of these companies both for the supply of certain services and products necessary for the
operation of our business, such as hardware and certain software products and services (in which case,
we refer to them as suppliers), and for the provision of products and services that we manage, implement
and co-develop to our customers (in which case we refer to them as partners). The IT products and
technologies that we manage, implement and co-develop with our partners include, among others,
cybersecurity, cloud, AI and robotic process automation. For example, in 2022 we partnered with
Siemens Digital Technologies and Google Cloud to deliver a digital business platform and machine
learning applications both targeted at industrial customers. We also cooperate with these partners in
connection with the activities we conduct in relation to Digitech and System Integration. See “—Our
_Business—Activities.”_

Certain of our agreements for the supply of services and products including with our suppliers and
partners contain change of control provisions that, subject to certain conditions, may allow the
counterparty to terminate the contract.

We use products and services provided by our suppliers in the provision of our own products and
services as follows:

- **_Integration. Products and services provided by our suppliers are often complementary to our_**
own products and services, and we are able to integrate our own offerings with those of our
suppliers. For example, we integrate Salesforce relationship management services into our own
solutions.

- **_Incorporation. We enter into agreements for the supply of products and services that are_**
necessary for the operation of our products and services. For example, we license portions of
code that we then incorporate into our own software and we worked with Cisco to develop
Hycards, a platform for the management of membership cards, loyalty programs and for the
optimization of relationships with customers, updating our customers’ existing loyalty program
software.

- **_Resale. We enter into distribution agreements that allow us to sell products and services of our_**
suppliers to our customers. For example, we sell products and services provided by SAP,
Oracle, Red Hat and AWS.


-----

We benefit from long-lasting multi-year relationships with our suppliers and partners and, given our
nature of open partner ecosystem, we constantly continue to expand our partnership network.

**Research and Development**

Innovation has always been a key element for our competitiveness, long-term sustainability and success.
We continuously invest in R&D and innovation to support the ongoing improvement of our organization
in increasing our competitive capacity and fulfilling the needs of a fluid, rapidly changing market. We
believe that investing in R&D will help us continue to grow in the future.

We spent approximately €25 million in 2022 on R&D. As of the date of this Offering Memorandum,
we are involved in more than 100 research projects within the following key areas, spanning across all
our industry verticals: digital industry, smart transportation, digital and physical security, agrifood,
smart city, smart government, energy, waste management, 5G, digital media, cloud, big data,
blockchain and AI. Research projects are implemented in our six research labs located in Italy. Recently,
we have launched several key R&D initiatives, including among others a multi-year project together
with 30 different partners from multiple countries focusing on the creation of the first European energy
data space. Such space will offer an ecosystem enabling users to access data in a secure and
interoperable way, while aiming to facilitate a greater efficiency of energy systems and a green
transition.

Our R&D Lab department is composed of a dedicated team of over 500 professionals, which includes
researchers and data scientists. We employ all members of our R&D Lab and operate all of our internal
R&D activities in-house, while collaborating with our partners on larger research projects, particularly
those sponsored by government entities, such as projects funded by EU and national grants. Our
employees hold best-in-class certifications issued by our partners. Our R&D Lab, the core driver of our
product and service innovation process, works closely with the following other business units:

- Our _Innovators’ Network, comprises several innovation experts working among our market_
verticals and Group companies to analyze market trends and weaknesses and to translate them
in ideas for innovative solutions and products. Our R&D Lab transforms the Innovators’
Network’s ideas into prototypes using the most innovative technologies and methods.

- Our _Development Labs, comprising a dedicated group of professionals (including senior_
developers and solution architects), use research performed in other units for the development
of state-of-the art technologies that can be commercialized for the benefit of our customers.

- Our Products Labs, comprising a dedicated group of professionals (including subject matter
domain experts, business process analysts and solution architects), are devoted to designing,
developing and maintaining our proprietary solutions.

- Our Competence Centers, staffed by a team of consultants with deep experience in design
methodology, service design, project management tools and techniques, development
methodology, cybersecurity, field management solutions, managed content services, document
management, machine learning, data analysis, design thinking, and tools and security and work
to support the design and development processes of the Innovators Network, Development Labs
and Products Labs.

Our R&D Lab, together with our Innovators Network, Development Labs, Products Labs and
Competence Centers, incubate and prototype new concepts through applied R&D projects in order to
enrich our client offerings with innovative solutions and products.

Several of our research projects result in technologies that are used in our IT services, software and
digital platforms. The results of our research projects are transforming and improving our offerings to
our customers. For example, our Digital Enabler ecosystem platform, which provides a comprehensive
solution to facilitating a data-driven digital transformation of our customers’ organizations, is the


-----

outcome of several European research projects based on FIWARE principles and assets in which we
participated. In connection with the COVID-19 outbreak, our Digital Enabler assisted the accelerated
development of a digital tool aimed at both analyzing and monitoring the spread of COVID-19 on
several Italian regions.

We believe we are among the most active ICT research companies in Europe, attracting funds from
national and EU research programs, being ranked among the top 10 European private for profit
companies (and the first in Italy) in terms of EU funding under the European Union’s Horizon 2020
Programme for Research and Innovation. While, as of the date of this Offering Memorandum, no
official documentation has been made available yet by the European Commission, we have been
awarded research funding under the new Horizon Europe 2021-2027 Programme for over 30 initiatives
and are finalizing the grant signature process for further ten initiatives. This confirms our ability to
submit high-quality research projects, and to maintain a strong position within the European research
landscape. In addition, we have been actively engaged in significant research and innovation initiatives
throughout Europe including, among others, GaiaX, the International Data Space Association,
FIWARE, the BigDataValue Association, AIOTI, ECSO and the Data Space Business Alliance.

Moreover, our focus on innovation is also evidenced by both being among the founding Italian partner
organizations, and one of the most active players in EIT Digital, an European Institute of Innovation
and Technology (“EIT”) Knowledge and Innovation Community (“KIC”) focused on strengthening
Europe’s position in the digital world by delivering digital innovations to the market and developing
entrepreneurial talent to globally impact economic growth and improved quality of life. In addition, in
2020 we have been selected among the recipients of the “Global MIKE (Most Innovative Knowledge
Enterprise) Award”, a renowned international recognition awarded to companies consistently
displaying best practices for innovation.

Moreover, to better serve our customers, our research activities enable us to form and maintain strong
connections with a broad network of industrial and scientific partnerships and global collaborations.
We maintain global research partnerships with more than 150 universities and have strategic alliances
with several research centers in Europe, the United States, Latin America and Asia, such as Imperial

We also deploy a significant amount of resources for the training of our technology engineers, core

We believe that our strong focus on R&D as well as the significant amount of resources deployed to

**Sales and Marketing**

We market our solutions and services to both existing and potential customers directly through our inhouse sales and business development teams. Our sales and marketing strategy targets markets by


-----

activity type to deliver key industry-specific and multi-industry service offerings to our customers. We
leverage our broad, multi-industry service offerings to develop packaged solutions tailored to achieve
a specific scope of work that we then offer to corporate customers, while maintaining a disciplined
approach to pricing and contracting. We also focus on developing prospective customer relationships
through market research and analysis, renewing expiring contracts and leveraging existing client
relationships to offer additional services. Our sales efforts typically involve extended selling cycles and
our expertise in specific industries is critical to secure new business opportunities. Our sales force
receives a fixed salary and an additional variable portion based on performance.

We have designated account managers for each of our strategic customer relationships. The account
manager is supported by our Competence Centers to ensure the best possible solution is provided to our
customers. Our sales force is primarily organized by industry vertical-specific teams that are supported
by activity-specific personnel. Significant new business opportunities are reviewed by business and
sales leaders from the applicable industry vertical, operations personnel, and members of our finance
department. If they determine that the new business is aligned with our strategic objectives and a good
use of our resources, then our business development team is authorized to pursue the opportunity. Our
sales and marketing teams coordinate to ensure the effective targeting of prospective customers. In
addition, customers of our Digitech solutions are assisted by a dedicated customer relationship team of
trained Digitech professionals, with the aim of providing on-going specialized support.

We provide value to our customers based in part on a differentiated range of proprietary inventions,

OF FINANCIAL SERVICES” related to the core business of Be.

Our business relies on software. With respect to proprietary software, we claim copyright on all such
software, registering works which may be accessible to third parties. In addition, we rely on maintaining

**Quality Assurance**

We believe that providing a consistent high-quality service is critical in our customers’ decision to retain
our services and for us to build long-term relationships with them. Our quality control framework is
based on the certification of our operations and processes, regular process audits by our internal
compliance team and independent external quality assurance providers. Our operations and processes
are certified, inter alia, to the following internationally recognized standards:

- ISO 45001:2018: this standard regulates the adoption of a safety management system, aimed at
ensuring the health and safety of employed workforce, the prevention of work-related injuries


-----

and illnesses, and the proactive improvement of our performance in key occupational, health
and safety metrics.

- ISO 37001:2016: this standard regulates the adoption of an anti-bribery management system,
through the deployment and periodic revision of measures aimed at preventing and combating
bribery occurrences.

- UNI EN ISO 9001:2015: this standard regulates the provision of IT service solutions, the
analysis, design and development of software, the design and supply of full outsourcing
services, the provision of computer systems installation, management and support and the
design and provision of strategic ICT infrastructure, among others.

- ISO-IEC 27001:2013: this standard regulates the design and provision for the retention of
digital documents and the design, development and provision of services for the management
of computerized administration of personnel, among others.

- ISO-IEC 20000-1:2018: this standard regulates the provision of IT service management
systems that support the provisioning of data center services such as application and facility
management.

- ISO 14064-1:2018: this standard regulates the quantification and reporting of greenhouse gas
emissions, by promoting consistency, transparency and credibility in counting emissions and
by incentivizing the adoption of a technological approach to improve business efficiency.

- ISO 14001:2015: this standard regulates the provision of data center, hosting, housing,
managed service, server farm, storage, backup and cloud services, among others.

- AQAP 2110/AQAP 2210: this standard developed by NATO establishes standards for the
design, development and maintenance of IT systems suitable for military use.

In addition, on December 2022 we became a certified entity by Teledife, the general directorate of
telecommunications, IT and advanced technologies of the Italian Ministry of Defence.

We are routinely subject to audits by our customers in regard to our compliance with the
abovementioned standards. Certain of our contracts, such as for example our contracts with certain
military customers, include provisions that allow such customers to terminate their contracts with us in
case we fail to maintain our compliance with the abovementioned standards. We also publish a
Corporate Social Responsibility Report on a yearly basis, which is available on our website. In addition,
since 2021 we provide a yearly progress update towards the implementation of the UN global compact
principles.

**Regulation**

In providing services and solutions to customers, we often manage, utilize and store sensitive or
confidential customer or company data, including personal data, and therefore we must comply with
strict data protection and privacy laws, such as the GDPR, in all the jurisdictions in which we operate.
In addition, participation in public tenders subjects us to further regulation under the Italian Code of
Public Contracts (the “ICPP”), currently set forth in Legislative Decree No. 36 of March 31, 2023. The
ICPP replaced the previous code of public contracts set forth by Legislative Decree No. 50 of April 8,
2001, which, however, continues to regulate all the tender procedures based on calls for bids published
before April 1, 2023. The provisions of the ICPP are mainly aimed at ensuring that public contracting
authorities/entities apply the best criteria to select contractors in terms of costs and quality of the
relevant offers in compliance with the EU principles of efficiency, free competition, non-discrimination,
transparency and proportionality.


-----

According to the ICPP, participation in public tenders requires us to meet three main sets of
requirements, namely (i) general morality requirements, (ii) economic and financial capacity and (iii)
technical and professional skills. Requirements (ii) and (iii) are identified by the awarding entities on a
case-by-case basis since they relate and proportionate to the subject matter of the public tender;
requirement (i) has a general scope and aims at excluding from the tenders, amongst others: (a) subjects
or entities that have been convicted of certain types of crimes with a non-appealable judgment
(including, participation in criminal organizations, corruption, bribery, fraud, terrorism and mafiarelated crimes), (b) entities facing bankruptcy or involved in proceedings for the declaration of
bankruptcy, (c) entities which failed to pay social security contributions or taxes, (d) subjects or entities
found guilty of material professional misconduct which renders their integrity or reliability
questionable, (e) entities which rendered misrepresentations, (f) entities subject to the sanctions
disqualifying them from exercising certain activities as provided by LD 231/2001.

Through our acquisition of Cybertech, a company specialized in offering cybersecurity solutions, we
significantly increased our cybersecurity capabilities and enhanced our internal data protection and
security framework, with the aim of deploying an infrastructure able to address vulnerabilities and
providing our customers with advanced security services.

We constantly monitor the evolution of cyber threats and routinely investigate potential system
vulnerabilities through our cyber intelligence capabilities. We have also created a dedicated corporate
security department, which is entrusted with the monitoring of our cybersecurity control system, and
the review of our cyber infrastructure and integrated organizational model. For example, we maintain
the ability to successfully thwart cyberattack attempts (including phishing attacks) by leveraging on our
security operation center (which operates on a 24/7 basis) on a 24x7 Security Operation Center and our
incident management team.

**Environment**

We are committed to respecting the environment also through the reduction of the impact of our
business activities on the environment. We have implemented processes to this effect and systematically
evaluate the environmental impact of our activities. We have established contingency plans for the
management of emergencies with potentially hazardous outcomes for the environment and through an
evaluation of the environmental consequences of our new products and services. Although we consider
our activities to have a low pollution risk, we have implemented an ISO 14001:2015-certified


-----

environmental management system, a certification which also covers our Rome, Pont-Saint-Martin,
Vicenza, Naples and Palermo sites and our subsidiaries operating at those sites (i.e., the Company,
Municipia, EDH, Nexen and Webresults). This management system, along with our annual ESG
reporting, allows us to systematically evaluate the environmental impact of our activities, monitor
performance and improve processes linked to the relevant environmental factors (electricity
consumption, fuel and electronic waste and risks related to land spills) with respect to our three data
centers in Vicenza, Turin, and Pont-Saint-Martin, our offices in Italy, and our car fleet. We also comply
with applicable legislation with respect to the control of emissions into the atmosphere, soil and water,
and have monitored the carbon footprint of our Italian operations since 2019, in accordance with the
Green House Gas Protocol (GHG) GHG-Green House Gas Protocol. In addition, we implemented a
ISO 14064-1:2018 certified greenhouse gas emissions quantification and reporting system. Such
certification recognizes our adoption of a technological framework to quantify, monitor and ultimately
reduce CO2 emissions, while improving the overall efficiency and environmental impact of our business
activities.

In 2021, we recorded an 8% decrease in Scope 1 and 2 emissions, while electricity usage by our data
centers also decreased by 14%. In addition, 65% of the electricity consumed at our Italian offices and
data centers is sourced from renewable sources. We also implemented an energy efficiency project at
our Pont-Saint-Martin data center, which has driven the improvement of the local power usage
effectiveness score (PUE) from 1.52 to 1.51. We deploy resources that we consider sufficient for the
implementation of our environmental policies and objectives. We maintain a high level of sustainability
by guaranteeing that the majority of the electronic waste produced by the data centers is reused in other
industrial sectors. To optimize the management of electronic waste, we have implemented a sustainable
system in the Italian offices that enable us to limit the costs of purchasing new PCs and has a more
limited impact on the environment, with a lower average standard production of electronic waste related
to PC replacement. For several years, the Group’s Technological Infrastructure Services (“SIT”) office
has developed a strong and efficient system for the restoration of damaged computers through the
replacement of damaged or obsolete components, which contributes to a more sustainable use of
available resources and, at the same time, reduces our operational costs.

We also comply with applicable regulations concerning the responsible use of energy and the
sustainable use of transportation, including Law No. 10 of January 9, 1991, the Decree of the Ministry
of the Environment of March 27, 1998 and Legislative Decree No. 152 of April 3, 2006, and we have
identified the competent energy manager. In order to limit our carbon foot print and greenhouse gas
emissions, we have adopted a business travel policy that places special emphasis on fuel consumption
and emission limits also to reduce the average fuel consumption threshold, thereby ensuring a decline
in CO2 and other polluting emissions caused by our employees.

Our Group offices are all plastic-free and our offices in Rome and Milan are LEED certified.

Over recent years, we have intensified our commitment to sustainability and expanded initiatives for
reporting to our stakeholders on social responsibility. In particular, we strongly support the three ESG
parameters, as enshrined in the sustainability goals of the UN Agenda 2030, which aims to ensure a
sustainable future for people, business and society by the targeting innovative digital solutions in the
fields of energy and mobility transition, sustainable consumption, energy and resource-saving
production, and transparent supply chains. In addition, in 2021 we became a signatory under the UN
global compact. By adhering to the UN global compact, we committed to making the UN global
compact and its principles in the areas of human rights, labor, environment and anti-corruption and
integral part of our strategy, culture and day-to-day operations. To this end, we also committed to report
on a yearly basis on our progress towards the implementation of these principles as well as on the
performance of our CSR framework, the first such report being provided in 2021. As a further testament
to our commitment to the Group’s sustainability policies and their compliance with the global reporting
initiative (GRI) standards, in December 2022, we published our 2021 Sustainability Report, which for
the first time, was verified by Deloitte as a third-party reviewer. Moreover, in 2022 we received the
following third-party recognitions for our environmental performance: CDP-Climate Change (with a


-----

score of: C=Awareness), EcoVadis (with an environment score of: 70/100) and Open-es (with a plant
score of: 70/100)

We are also maintaining a strong focus on protecting customer data, being certified pursuant to ISO
27001:2017, and we implemented appropriate security management standards which are routinely
monitored. In addition, we have been recently recognized as a leading company within the cybersecurity
sector in terms of promoting sustainability and received a special mention at the Biblioteca Bilancio

for employees in the mechanical engineering sector, CCNL for employees in the trade companies sector,
CCNL for employees in the telecommunications sector and CCNL for executives in the industrial
sector.

Trade unions and work councils are active at all our premises and as of December 31, 2022, 10.5% of
our employees were unionized. We have entered into a company-wide collective agreement with trade
unions active in our company regulating annual performance bonuses and employee social security. We
have also entered into a further company-wide collective agreement regulating remuneration and health
insurance of executives. We consider our relations with employees, trade unions, and work councils to
be good and we have not experienced any significant labor issues in the past three years.

We are required by Italian law to employ employees considered by law to be disabled in a percentage
constituting at least 7% of our workforce. We are also required by Italian law to employ employees
considered by law to be disadvantaged in a percentage constituting at least 1% of our workforce. As of
December 31, 2022, we were in compliance with these legal requirements.


-----

Following completion of the Be Acquisition and the consolidation of the Be Group into our business,
we have added approximately 1,934 new employees to our Group.

**Pensions**

Italian law provides that, upon termination of employment, Italian employees are entitled to severance
pay (trattamento di fine rapporto) based on their annual salary, the duration of their employment and
the rate of inflation. We have in place both defined-contribution and defined-benefit pension plans. We
make pension contributions on behalf of our employees as required by applicable Italian law. Other
than increases in contributions required by law, we do not expect significant pension liabilities going
forward.

**Insurance**

As an integral part of our risk management program, we maintain insurance coverage for property
damage, data breaches, business interruptions, directors’ and officers’ liability and product liability.
Insurance cover for these risks is provided through a combination of self-insured deductibles and annual
aggregates. Our insurance coverage is reviewed on an annual basis. We believe the levels of risks
insured, risks retained and the limits of insurance indemnity are broadly in line with similar companies
in the same industry sector, but we cannot guarantee that we could not be adversely affected by damage
or accidents despite possessing said insurance coverage. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to our
_Business and Industry—Our insurance coverage might not be sufficient and we might be subject to_
_uninsured losses.”_

**Legal Proceedings**

From time to time we become involved in claims and legal proceedings that arise in the ordinary course
of business, such as disputes with our customers and suppliers, authorities or business partners, labor
law disputes and disputes relating to intellectual property. These disputes can entail amounts that are
material for the operation of our business.

As of the date of the Offering Memorandum, we are involved, through our subsidiary, SISEV, in two
disputes against Sicilia Digitale S.p.A. (“Sicilia Digitale”) and Regione Siciliana for unpaid amounts of
€131.1 million in nominal value for both proceedings. In particular, in 2016, in the context of a claim
to obtain payment of approximately €80 million of unpaid invoices, Regione Siciliana and Sicilia
Digitale filed a counterclaim against us alleging a breach of contract and claiming damages for an
amount of €96 million. As of the date of this Offering Memorandum this litigation is still ongoing.
Following an order by the competent court, we settled a previous litigation against Sicilia Digitale for
unpaid invoices in an amount of approximately €20 million (of which €13 million were awarded to us
and the remainder to a co-contractor) as compared to an original amount claimed of approximately €30
million. Two appeals are currently pending with respect to such proceedings and the next hearings are
scheduled on June 9, 2023 and January 12, 2024. We have set-up an allowance for doubtful accounts
in relation to such proceedings, which, as of December 31, 2022 was equal to €27.8 (including a fund
for late interest equal to €53.3).

Other than what disclosed herein, we are currently not involved in any legal proceedings which, either
individually or in the aggregate, are expected to have a material adverse effect on our reputation,
financial position or results of operations. We note, however, that the outcome of legal proceedings can
be extremely difficult to predict, and we offer no assurances in this regard.

**_Management and Control Organizational Model Pursuant to LD 231/2001_**

The Company adopted a management and control organizational model in accordance with LD
231/2001, effective from November 2003 and lastly updated January 18, 2021. This organizational
model identifies areas where the Company and its subsidiaries could be at risk by mapping the structures


-----

and business processes of the company, and identifying the areas and business activities which are
potential “crime-risks” as well as the procedures and controls in place to avoid such crimes. Such
management and organizational model also governs the functions and powers of a dedicated
supervisory board (organismo di vigilanza) which is in charge of supervising the functioning of the
Company, the Company’s adherence to the management and organizational model and to the additional
internal procedures, and the Company’s commitment to constantly update those procedures.

**_Code of Ethics_**

In connection with our management and control organizational model in accordance with LD 231/2001,
we have adopted a code of ethics with which all our employees are required to comply. Our code of
ethics was first adopted in 2004 and is regularly updated, most recently in October 2022. Our code of
ethics outlines expected behavior of our employees, guidelines for the management of confidential
information and business conduct. Violations of our code of ethics can be reported through a
whistleblowing reporting portal, by mail service and through a publicly available e-mail address. Our
code of ethics prohibits retaliation against whistleblowing employees and guarantees their protection.
Our LD 231/2001 dedicated supervisory board (organismo di vigilanza) monitors overall compliance
and reviews reports of breaches of our code of ethics.

**_ISO 37001 Certification_**

The Company is certified under the ISO 37001 standard since December 2019. The ISO 37001 standard
provides guidance for establishing, implementing, maintaining, reviewing and improving an antibribery management system, and the related certification is granted to organizations that have
implemented an anti-bribery management system and related in compliance with such guidelines. ISO
37001-certified companies have higher chances of detecting bribery. In addition, in 2020 we
implemented a Group-wide policy of bribery prevention across all our subsidiaries.

which members of the Group’s senior management team have been able to subscribe to a portion of the
share capital of Centurion Midco S.à r.l., an indirect parent company of the Issuer. See “Principal
_Shareholders” and “Certain Relationships and Related Party Transactions—Existing Management Co-_
_Investment Plan.”_
